details:
Our latest IPA is in review on the App Store. However, we are facing issues because the provided user credentials do not have sufficient data to showcase the app’s functionality effectively.
To ensure a smooth review and approval process, we need to provide Apple with a test user that has comprehensive data. Please take the following actions:
Create/Identify a Test User – Ensure the account has enough data to demonstrate all key features of the app.
Verify Functional Coverage – The test user should be able to showcase workflows,  and other functionalities.
Share  Credentials – Provide the new test login details along with any necessary instructions or test scenarios.
Please prioritize this and share the updated credentials ASAP so we can avoid delays in the approval process.

Summary page 
TAb 1- Overview
Widget-1 - Welcome card,
Widget-2 - Attendance
Widget-3 - Day planner
Widget -4 - My Appointments
Widget -5 - My Task
Widget -6 - Quick Links
Widget -7 -RSS feeds

TAb 2-  insights
subject: User Credentials Required for App Store Review.

details:
The Incident Layout has a field called "Root Cause" under RCA Details (Refer to the attached screenshot). The values in this field need to be changed to have uniform RCA codes that can be shared with customers. Those RCA fields are more from a production environment perspective than an Engineering perspective.
Existing fields need to be deleted, and the following fields need to be added, first in the test environment and then in production.

Application Defect
Incorrect Configuration
Application Limitation	
Documentation Bug	
Data Issue Due to Application	
Third-Party Libraries	
System Capacity Issues	
Database Maintenance	
User Error	
Wrong Deployment	
Environment - Network	
Environment - OS/Runtime	
Environment - Compute Resources	
Enivronment - Space / Storage	
Hardware
Third-Party Integrations	
Third-Party Software	
Database Issues	
Data Issue not due to Application
Expected Functionality	
New Requirement	
Undetermined
subject: Modification of RCA options

Dear Team,

I would like to request the creation of a Custom View in the portal for the account Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Below are the details and prerequisites for the configuration:

Account:

 - Reserve Bank of India (RBI)

Visibility (Login IDs):
 - ashisin2@in.ibm.com
 - kapil.kulkarni@crmnext.com
 - prajwal.wakhare@businessnext.com
 - Users tagged with this account

Filter Criteria:

- Account: Reserve Bank of India (RBI)
- Applies To: Customer UAT, Production, Live Site, SIT, Pre-Production
- Case Owner: Ashish Singh

View Columns:
 - Case ID
 - Subject
 - Account Name
 - Status Code
 - Process
 - Module
 - Priority
 - Current Owner
 - Assigned To
 - Reported On
 - Last Modified On

Filters:
 - Case ID
 - Status Code
 - Module
 - Assigned To
 - Reported On
 - Last Modified On
 - Module
 - Sub Module

Additional Notes:
 - Export option should be enabled for this view.
 - Visibility should be restricted to the login IDs mentioned above

Kindly configure the view as per the above specifications. Please let me know in case of any clarifications.

details:
Out Of TAT-

Awaiting Input>30 days
Resolved with SA>30 Days

 Process of auto closure of non actioned case by delivery should be auto updated in azure:Either state should be closed or any other should be synced in azure from MY
We are implementing a process to automatically close cases in the following statuses to help clean up old and inactive data except Production cases:
Invalid

Configuration Issue
Is a Feature
Not a Bug
Awaiting Inputs
Workaround Provided
Without timely action, these cases accumulate over time and impact overall tracking and reporting. Once a case is closed through this process, it will no longer be eligible for Reopen or transition to any other status. If further action is required, ESG will need to raise a new case.
Below is the escalation matrix for this closure process:
After Week 4:
The case will be closed automatically, and a notification email will be sent to the case creator, the case creator’s manager, and the portfolio owner.
subject: MY- Azure Integration - Out Of TAT

details:
Hello, we've had a few reports of ATM cards (specifically ATM cards that are owned by a joint owner instead of primary) have an error at the last step of verification. These are manually entered card #s, not through Tellergy integration. 

Sample: card *0407 on 57062878 - when you search by this card number, it finds the member successfully, but on the last step of verification, we get an error. We've confirmed this issue with at least two ATM cards, both of which happen to be owned by the joint owner on the account. Our tellers report no issues with primary owned ATM cards. See attached for error received.
subject: ATM Card Search Verification Error

details:
CRM application domain changes have been postponed until April 2026. Consequently, the previously shared APK (6.166.13) is not usable due to this delay.

As confirmed with the Bank MDM team, the old version (6.166.9) was not uploaded over the new version, and a new APK version is urgently required to close the open audit point.

Our MDM team has proposed two possible approaches. Please review and confirm the next step at the earliest:

1.	Share the currently uploaded APK file with the vendor team and request them to remove the new domain changes and provide an updated APK file.
2.	Request the vendor team to share the latest APK file with the existing domain configuration.

Note : When domain changes are implemented in the future, you will need to share another updated version with the new domain configuration.
Your prompt response is critical to avoid further delays and ensure compliance. Please confirm the preferred approach as soon as possible.
subject: Urgent: Action Required Regarding CRM Application APK

details:
Problem Statement:
In the Case module, as the number of subcategories increases, configuring dependent fields using Dependent field Visibility reaches a functional limitation and becomes difficult to maintain.

Proposed Solution:
Implement a Mashup Control that triggers case page load to hide and unhide required fields. The approach would be as follows:

Dump all relevant fields into a dedicated section on the layout.
Maintain a Master Data Mapping (MDM) that contains:
Subcategory name
List of field names that should be visible for that subcategory
On load, the mashup will:
Identify the selected subcategory on the layout
Fetch the corresponding field list from the MDM
Make all fields in the section invisible by default
Set only the fields mapped in the MDM as visible
Benefits:

Eliminates the need to repeatedly update Dependent field Visibility rules
Simplifies maintenance by moving the logic to data configuration instead of layout
Any new subcategory addition or update will only require an MDM update, not rule changes
Future Impact / Considerations:

Continued support for Mashup Controls in future platform builds
Dependency on internal field identifiers (e.g., data-autoid) remaining stable
Please let me know your thoughts or if you’d like to discuss this approach further. Sharing a video of small POC demo implemented.

 

In This video, we have chosen a field named "Territory" in column "parentdataautoid" and basis of dropdown values from column "parentvalue",  the fields mapped in column "showdataautoid" becomes Visible.



https://crmnext-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/r/personal/rohit_ghaisas_businessnext_com/Documents/Microsoft%20Teams%20Chat%20Files/FieldControlHideShow.mp4?csf=1&web=1&e=75Sqa1&nav=eyJyZWZlcnJhbEluZm8iOnsicmVmZXJyYWxBcHAiOiJTdHJlYW1XZWJBcHAiLCJyZWZlcnJhbFZpZXciOiJTaGFyZURpYWxvZy1MaW5rIiwicmVmZXJyYWxBcHBQbGF0Zm9ybSI6IldlYiIsInJlZmVycmFsTW9kZSI6InZpZXcifX0%3d&referrer=Outlook.Desktop&referrerScenario=email-linkwithembed
subject: Mashup Approach to Resolve Field Dependency on Case Module -- Product Feasibility Check

details:
We sent an email over alerting of this issue. MV is not displaying verbal passwords on each account a member is associated with. It is only showing one password. The password stored in the primary name record Mother's Maiden Name field is used for all signers on an account. For a person with access to multiple different accounts, the passwords may be different and need to all be displayed on the MV screen, otherwise, our representatives may be given a verbal password that is correct but is not displayed on the MV screen to verify. During UAT, we were seeing verbal passwords separated by a comma, so there were multiple showing up, and that recently seemed to change. We thought this was due to the matrix changes that were in development, but it appears not.

It seems that with this structure, authorized signers would never have a verbal pw available in MV, unless they happen to have a primary account of their own with a pw in their primary name record
subject: Verbal Passwords missing in Mbr Verification

details:
First Attempt (Failure Scenario):

1.The error code was changed to 0001 in TERMSIMAPIXML to simulate a document download failure.

2.As expected, no document was downloaded.

3.An error popup was displayed, and the message indicated that 1 attempt was left.

4.No case was created for this first failed attempt, which is the expected behavior.

Second Attempt (Expected Success Scenario):

1.The error code was then changed to 0000 to simulate a successful download scenario.

2.The document download was attempted again.

3.However, no document was downloaded.

4.The same error popup that is shown for the first-attempt failure was displayed again.

5.The second attempt was also treated as a failure, and a case was created with a new status.

Issue:
Even after setting the error code to success (0000) for the second attempt, the document is not downloaded, and the system continues to treat the attempt as a failure using the same error handling logic as the first attempt. This behavior is incorrect, as the second attempt should result in a successful document download.
subject: P1 | HDFC DAP PO | Changes in Digital token as per SQ report | Balance Confirmation Document Download Fails on Second Attempt Despite Success Error Code

As discussed with @Vivek Kumarand @LALCHAND SHIVPUJAN KUMBHAR, below is a consolidated summary of pending items, proposed approaches, and configuration clarifications.
Pending Items in Implementation
CDC syncing should occur only when objects.lastModifiedOn < table.insertedOn.

The above is requierd to handle following scenarios :-
-> If entry is already present in Kafka and the records is updated from UI after inserting the record into the clickhousesyncrecord. UI Update will be lost
-> If entry is already present in Kafka and we use the Direct method to insert data into clickhouse DB. Latest update will be lost

this condition can not be handle by developer as there is not support for store procedure

What is the purpose of this notification?
The purpose of this notification is to provide details on security updates for CVE-2026-21509 that were released on January 26, 2026.
 
Executive Summary

Reliance on untrusted inputs in a security decision in Microsoft Office allows an unauthorized attacker to bypass a security feature locally.
 
Details about this vulnerability
 
CVE-2026-21509	Microsoft Office Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
Impact	Security Feature Bypass
Severity	Important
Publicly Disclosed?	Yes
Known Exploits?	Yes
Exploitability	Exploitation Detected
CVSS Score Metrics	Base CVSS Score: 7.8	Privileges Required: None	Confidentiality: High
	Attack Vector: Local	User Interaction: Required	Integrity: High
	Attack Complexity: Low	Scope: Unchanged	Availability: High
Affected Software	Microsoft Office
More Information	https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2026-21509

 
Regarding Information Consistency
We strive to provide you with accurate information in static (this mail) and dynamic (web-based) content. Microsoft’s security content posted to the web is often updated to reflect late-breaking information. If this results in an inconsistency between the information here and the information in Microsoft’s published web-based security content, the information in Microsoft’s published web-based security content is authoritative.
subject: OOB Notification - Security updates released 	out-of-band for CVE-2026-21509

details:
Observation : Missing Security headers
Justification :
CRMNEXT permits the use of inline resources such as:
• Inline script elements (<script>...</script>)
• JavaScript URLs (javascript: in links)
• Inline event handlers (e.g., onclick, onmouseover)
• Inline styles (style="..." attributes)
• The use of eval() and similar functions to execute dynamically generated JavaScript code.
While unsafe-inline and unsafe-eval weaken CSP by allowing potentially dangerous script execution, the overall risk is substantially reduced by combining:
• X-Frame-Options to prevent framing-based attacks.
• X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block (header enables browser-based protection against reflected XSS attacks by stopping page rendering when an XSS attack is detected)
• Code-level defences (input validation, output encoding, and sanitization) to neutralize malicious payloads before they are executed.
Input validation, output encoding, and sanitization are effective in mitigating XSS by ensuring that potentially malicious inputs are either rejected or rendered harmless.
subject: KLI || Justification to take exception

details:
Hello Team,
 
A critical vulnerability has been discovered in the AdonisJS framework’s bodyparser component, tracked as  CVE-2026-21440 (CVSS score: 9.2). The flaw allows attackers to exploit improper handling of file uploads and request parsing to perform arbitrary file writes on the server. This means a malicious actor could craft specially designed requests that bypass validation and write files to sensitive directories, potentially leading to remote code execution, privilege escalation, or full system compromise. The vulnerability affects deployments using the vulnerable bodyparser versions and poses a significant risk to applications built on AdonisJS, especially those exposed to untrusted input. Immediate remediation is required by upgrading to the patched release, applying strict file upload validation, and monitoring for suspicious file system activity. This issue highlights the importance of secure request parsing in web frameworks, as exploitation could result in severe operational and security impacts.
 
Impact 
 
The impact of the AdonisJS Bodyparser vulnerability (CVSS 9.2) is highly severe, as it allows attackers to perform arbitrary file writes on the server’s filesystem. By exploiting this flaw, a malicious actor could overwrite critical application files, drop malicious scripts, or plant backdoors, ultimately leading to remote code execution and full compromise of the affected server. This exposes organizations to risks such as data breaches, service disruption, privilege escalation, and persistence of unauthorized access. Since AdonisJS is commonly used to build production web applications, exploitation could directly affect business-critical services and sensitive user data. The vulnerability’s high CVSS score reflects its potential to cause widespread operational and security damage if not remediated promptly.
 
Recommended Action 
 
1.	Upgrade Immediately – Apply the latest patched version of AdonisJS and its bodyparser component to eliminate the flaw.
2.	Restrict File Uploads – Enforce strict validation and sanitization of file upload parameters, including file names, paths, and extensions.
3.	Use Safe Directories – Configure uploads to be stored only in controlled, non-executable directories with limited permissions.
4.	Implement Access Controls – Limit file upload functionality to trusted users and authenticated sessions to reduce exposure.
5.	Apply Defense-in-Depth – Harden servers with least-privilege principles, disable unnecessary services, and enforce OS-level protections.
6.	Conduct Security Testing – Perform regular penetration testing and code reviews to identify potential weaknesses in request parsing and file handling.
7.	Educate Developers – Train teams on secure coding practices for handling user input and file uploads to prevent similar issues
 
Reference 
Critical AdonisJS Bodyparser Flaw (CVSS 9.2) Enables Arbitrary File Write on Servers
subject: Hacker News | Critical AdonisJS Bodyparser Flaw (CVSS 9.2) Enables Arbitrary File Write on Servers

1. Application /Web servers service down – Detect when the application/Web service stop or become unresponsive.

2. Configuration changes - Monitor for any unauthorized or unexpected changes in configuration files

4. Database Connection Failure / DB Unreachable - All transactions and workflows fail

5. API Dependency Failure (Upstream/Downstream Service Down) - External/internal service outage affects app

6. Sudden Spike in Application Errors (4xx/5xx Error Surge) - DoS / overload / backend crash detection

details:
1. Background & Context
-- During implementation and testing of CSV-based integrations in CRMNEXT, we observed inconsistent behavior between:
-- PostgreSQL native import (pgAdmin4 – Import/Export functionality)
-- CRMNEXT “Read from Data Source” type of task


1. Header Name Dependency vs Position-Based Import
1.1 Observed Behavior
PostgreSQL (pgAdmin Import):
Imports CSV based on column position
Header names are ignored
CRMNEXT (Read from Data Source):
Requires exact column header name match
File is skipped even when:
Column count is correct
Column order is correct
Datatypes are compatible

1.2 Impact
Client files with different header naming conventions cannot be processed
Manual file modification is required

1.3 Clarification Required
Is position-based CSV loading supported in CRMNEXT?
If not, is this a known limitation?

1.4 Expected Behavior
Ability to load CSV files based on column position, similar to PostgreSQL COPY

1.5 Required Outcome
Configurable option:
Header-based load (current)
Position-based load (new)

2. Special Characters in Header Names
2.1 Observed Behavior
Client CSV headers contain special characters:
Example: Lead__r.Status, format(Date_of_Birth__c)

Table columns are created with exact same names
Despite this, the file is silently skipped
Removing headers allows successful processing

2.2 Impact
Client-provided files cannot be consumed without modification
No indication of failure reason

2.3 Clarification Required
Are special characters in column/header names supported?

2.4 Expected Behavior
Either:
Support special characters in headers
OR
Reject file with a clear validation error

2.5 Required Outcome
No silent skips due to special characters
Clear error or successful processing

3. Silent Skip & Missing Error Logging
3.1 Observed Behavior
In failure scenarios (header mismatch, special characters, validation issues):
File is skipped
No exception or error is logged

3.2 Impact
No operational visibility
Root cause cannot be identified

3.3 Expected Behavior
Every skipped or rejected file should:
Raise an exception
Log the exact reason for failure

3.4 Required Outcome
Mandatory error logging for all skip/failure scenarios in Read from Data Source tasks

4. Summary of Requirements
Support position-based CSV import
Define and support special characters in headers
Eliminate silent skips by enforcing error logging
subject: READ FROM DATA SOURCE

details:
select 
  Acc_ex1_138, 
  AccountID, 
  ROWNUMBER 
from 
  (
    select 
      RowNumberSql.*, 
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        ORDER BY 
          AccountID DESC
      ) AS ROWNUMBER 
    from 
      (
        select 
          cast(
            Acc_ex1_138 as nvarchar(261)
          ) AS Acc_ex1_138, 
          AccountID 
        from 
          (
            select 
              Accounts.OwnerId, 
              Acc_ex1_138, 
              Accounts.accountid, 
              Accounts.OfficePhone, 
              Accounts.Phone, 
              Accounts.KeyContactID, 
              Accounts.ShortName, 
              Accounts.Name, 
              Accounts.Topparent as Topparent, 
              Accounts.Hi, 
              Accounts.Lo as Lo, 
              Accounts.PreviousStatusCodeId, 
              Accounts.layoutId, 
              Accounts.StatusCodeId, 
              Accounts.ParentID, 
              Accounts.SecureKeyId, 
              Accounts.GEOLATITUDE, 
              Accounts.GEOLONGITUDE 
            from 
              Accounts 
              INNER JOIN acc_ex1 ON Accounts.OwnerId = acc_ex1.OwnerId 
              AND Accounts.AccountID = acc_ex1.acc_ex1_Id 
            where 
              Accounts.OwnerId = @OwnerID 
              and Accounts.IsDefaultAccount = 0
          ) AS temSql 
        where 
          (
            cast(
              Acc_ex1_138 as nvarchar(261)
            ) <> '' 
            and cast(
              Acc_ex1_138 as nvarchar(261)
            ) is not null
          )
      ) AS RowNumberSql
  ) AS TempQuery 
WHERE 
  ROWNUMBER BETWEEN @startindex 
  AND @endindex
subject: Select Query is taking 11 mins to response

details:
We have checked with AWS & they have suggested to check (TTL - TIME TO LEAVE) configuration at application side for redis connection. With all the understanding, one question is arising here which you should answer and again check in your application that how cache expiry is configured at application level. 

How it is happening that cache is not getting auto clean up after the build 91 deployed in production on 6th of Nov evening.

Before 6th it is working properly at late evening at exactly same time around 20:30 it starts clearing the cache. Something is there in your application which clears the cache or expires the cache store in redis at certain time. If we are storing something in redis cache then it should also get expire/release and that logic will be present in your application code or at caching configuration file. Request you to thoroughly check with your product and come back with update on priority.

Kindly go through below links to have more idea on redis caching ttl in detailed.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/database-caching-strategies-using-redis/cache-validity.html
subject: Identify the cache clearing issue which is stopped post build 91 deployment | TTL cache expiry configuration need to be checked

details:
"Use Case & Problem 
Dashboards often 
•	Charts/Dashlets
•	Table-type charts
From a user’s perspective, all of these are expected to respond identically to the same filters and inputs.

•	Charts and dashlets follow one input pattern
•	Table charts follow a different input pattern
Because of this, for the same dashboard and same 
•	Charts show one count
•	Dashlets show the same count
•	Table charts show a different count
This is extremely confusing for users, as they assume all components are built on the same data logic.
Why This Is 
When numbers don’t match within the same dashboard, users lose confidence in the entire reporting system.
Expected 
All dashboard components must follow a single, consistent input and filtering mechanism."


INPUT WHEN ONLY FROMDATE IS ENTERED FROM THE UI, 
-- CHART LOGS
SELECT TOP 10 * FROM ExternalSourceLog 
WHERE DATASOURCEID = 1116469
ORDER BY LOGGINGID DESC

 Input parameter and values - Branch=;FromDate=01/15/2026 6:00:00 AM;ToDate=;ProductType=;ProductCategory=;Channel=;BusinessorRetail=;


-- TABULAR TYPE CHART LOGS
SELECT TOP 10 * FROM ExternalSourceLog 
WHERE DATASOURCEID = 1116440
ORDER BY LOGGINGID DESC

 Input parameter and values - FromDate=01/15/2026 12:01:00 AM;ToDate=01/25/2026 11:59:00 PM;ProductType=;Branch=;ProductCategory=;Channel=;BusinessorRetail=;
subject: Symbox 4.5 || Dashboards || SPM || Different Input Handling Logic for Charts/Dashlets, and Table Charts

details:
Dear BusinessNext Team,

Regarding the Document Generation issue, as discussed in our previous conversation, we require detailed information to support proper tracking of the document generation process, either in the form of application logs, kibana logs or database query (SELECT) references.
We expect this information to help us gain a clear understanding of the following points:
1. The number of users performing document generation and downloading documents within a given time period.
2. The number of users whose document generation is failed, in progress, and successfully completed, including the document download status.
3. For document generation processes that are currently running, the method used to estimate the remaining processing time until completion aslo to estimate the button stop on pop-up will be appeared.
4. The maximum capacity of the document generation process.
5. The system logic or handling mechanism when the document generation process reaches its maximum capacity or encounters an error. 
     - Additionally, is there any possibility to improve or increase the maximum generation capacity?
6. The system logic whenever user click the stop button and what it will do to another geneartion process either on other device or in same device.
7. Whether the required logs or data extraction can also be obtained from the Production environment (old build).
     - If not, we would appreciate a detailed explanation as to why this information cannot be retrieved from Production, not only the reason that the Production environment is running a different version.

We believe this information will greatly assist us in analyzing the issue, improving monitoring and troubleshooting, and responding appropriately to user complaints. At this time, we do not have sufficient data to clearly explain the document generation capacity to users or to properly address the reported issues.

Thank you for your support and cooperation.
subject: BNI | SIT| SR 386 | Document Generation Log

details:
We are encountering an exception after executing the OmnidocsJob, during which an API call is triggered.

Error 
“The value cannot be an empty string or composed entirely of whitespace. (Parameter ‘mediaType’)”

Based on our analysis, this issue occurs when the Content-Type header is either missing or passed as empty in the API request. The request and response details from the SIT environment are attached for reference.

Affected 
11.31.275.407 (SIT)

The same job configuration is being used across all builds; therefore, this appears to be a build-specific change in how missing or empty Content-Type headers are handled.

Please investigate this behavior and confirm whether any related changes were introduced in the affected builds.

Additionally, the same issue has been observed in the PNB project, and the PNB team has also raised a case for this problem.
Case  00533565
subject: Exception Observed After Running OmnidocsJob in Specific Builds -- This Applies to SIT

details:
"Use Case / Issue 
When a user applies global filters on a dashboard and refreshes the page, the previously selected filter values continue to appear in the global filter UI. However, these filters are not actually applied to the dashboard data.
This creates a mismatch between what the UI displays and what the data represents. Users assume the filters are active, while in reality they are not. The user must manually click Reset to clear the values, even after multiple refreshes.
Expected 
On refresh, 
•	The filters should be fully reapplied, or
•	The filter UI should reset completely."

details:
Here’s a clearer and more polished rewrite:

The error popup alert does not appear when page validation or group validation is applied on an accordion. The validation is implemented to ensure that the user opens all accordions and reviews the information before proceeding.

To achieve this, we followed the steps below:

Added three accordions to the layout.

The first accordion is open by default, while the other two are initially closed.

We update a flag variable when the closed accordions are opened.

Based on these flag values, a group validation action is created and triggered on the Continue button, so the user can proceed only after opening all accordions.

Although the validation logic works correctly, the error popup is not displayed when the validation fails. This issue occurs only in the case of accordions. In other scenarios, such as OTP resend, the error popup appears as expected.

We need a solution for the issue where the error message popup does not appear when group validation is applied to an accordion.
subject: The error message popup doesnot appear when we apply group validation for accordion
Travel Desk Request

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Validation on Total DI 

1. We observed that the validation message "Please fill Total 
    DI" is displayed even if Total DI % is populated. We further 
    observed that this is displayed when Parent Dealer field is 
    left blank but DI is populated. 

2. In other words, the validation message is incorrect. It will 
    confuse Users, same with what happened to Testers as we 
    initially thought this was a showstopper error. 

3. Note that DI can be 0 even if Loan Proceeds Payee or 
    Account Source is Dealer. While Total DI % is set as 
    mandatory field, it accepts 0 as a value  

4. A new field was also added, Loan Proceeds Payee. The 
    value selected in this field is also related as to when the 
    Parent Dealer is required. 

5. Tester also noted that even if Application Type is 
    REMIBURSEMENT or REFINANCING, Parent Dealer is still 
    required. Tester selected Account Source as DEALER, which 
    possibly explains it. But with the addition of new field Loan 
    Proceeds Payee, best to just link the Parent Dealer 
    requirement to this field. If Account Source is DEALER and 
    DEALER is the correct payee, then the Parent Dealer 
    requirement will be covered.  

6. Hence, update the validation message and mandatory tag 
    requirement. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Validation on Total DI and Parent Dealer 

1. Update the Validation Message
      From: Please fill Total DI. 
      To: Please fill Parent Dealer. 

2. Display the validation message under these conditions 
    only - where Parent Dealer is blank but:
    [1] Loan Proceeds Payee = DEALER 
    [2] When Total DI % > 0.00% (i.e. when DI is above 0.00) 

3. Related to #2, Parent Dealer is only mandatory if any one 
    of these conditions is met: 
    [1] Loan Proceeds Payee = DEALER 
    [2] When Total DI % > 0.00% (i.e. when DI is above 0.00) 

4. Remove other mandatory tag requirement for Parent Dealer 
    that are inconsistent with criteria [1] and [2] indicated above.

5. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s
subject: UNIT RECORD | Process: Validation on Total DI and Parent Dealer

details:
#
1. User is not able to create an Appointment for today's date but future time.
2. User is getting " Please select correct date/time" validation as the pop up.
3. Due to this user is not able to save the lead in Follow-Up status code.
 
#
1. Login into the application using "hong" as the username and "Cogent@1234" password.
2. Go to leads object and select "Wealth" layout to create a new lead.
3. Fill in the required details and save the lead in "New" status code.
4. Edit the lead and select "Follow Up" status code from the "Processing" milestone.
5. Fill in the Appointment details with today's date and time 2 hours from the current time.
6. After updating the details, try to save the lead.
7. User is getting " Please select correct date/time" validation as the pop up.
8. The Lead is not processing further.

details:
Problem - User is able to create lead for dedupe rule after clicking on revise button without any pop-up or notification.

Expected Result - There should be pop-up or notification to revise the details.

Instance
//s3.businessbywire.com/appdev/businessnext/Home/Summary
Login- losadmin &  keres@05

Steps - 
1. Login with above credentials.
2. Click on Create New button on Leads Home Page.
3. Select Credit Card from the dropdown.
4. Give ID No - 1234565432 and Product- 060 - Visa Rewards Card.
5. Fill other mandatory details.
6. Click on Save and Proceed. 
7. Dedupe rule pop-up appears with 'Ignore and Create' button and 'Revise' button.
8. Click on Revise button and then click on Save and Proceed.
9. It is creating the lead without any pop-up or notification. It should not allow to create lead until the duplicate details have been changed.

#Database Detail :

Hostname : 192.168.5.89

port : 5432

Database name : businessnext_rhb

username : postgres

Password : postgres

details:
Details: 
Insight Card while Application is in Initiate Verification Status 
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

1. The ALL, NBA, Unit, and Borrower Insight Cards must align 
    with verification actions of User. Details are in the Expected 
    Results 

2. Additionally, must align with the Data Entry insight card 
    design for a consistent User experience. Specifically, for 
    Update Borrower card: 
    a) In Data Entry: As a sample, when Main FA is in Proceed to 
        FDE status, the QDE Done/Update Borrower card is 
        already removed from the NBA. 
        [1] If User needs to update Borrower details, he will access 
             the Update Borrower insight card - which is in the
             Borrower Insight Card Group. 
        [2] The "QDE Done" is gone from the insight card name. 
             Retained is just "Update Borrower". 

    b) In Verification, we expect the same for consistency. Once 
        Main FA is saved in Initiate Verification, then the Initiate 
        Verification/Update Borrower card is removed from NBA. 
        But this is replaced with Update Borrower insight card 
        present in Borrower Insight Card Group. 

AppID: 179979

Expected Result:
Layout: Insight Cards 

1. Borrower Insight Card 
    a) Contains these cards in green color and in this order: 
        [1] View Borrower 
        [2] Update Borrower
    b) Remove Account and Reference as this should be in NBA

2. Unit Insight Card 
    a) Contains these cards in this order: 
        [1] View Unit 
        [2] Unit Inspection 
    b) Remove Unit Data Transfer. This action is not applicable 
        in Verification stage. 

3. NBA Insight Card 
    a) Contains these cards in yellow color and in this order: 
        [1] Initiate Underwriting / Update Borrower - initially 
             hidden, and is displayed only when all Verification 
             Records are complete (including Accounts & References 
             - if any) 
        [2] Update Verification 
        [3] Account and Reference  
    b) Remove Initiate Verification / Update Borrower. This 
        should be in Borrower Insight Card Group - with card name 
        changed to simply Update Borrower."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Layout: Credit Verification (Edit, Detail Page)
*For screenshots and images mentioned, refer to Excel UAT 
 Report Batch 03B #13 if not uploaded in Portal 

1. Total Monthly Payment Less Exclusions 
    App 183347, CB 160085, SP 160086 (see Issue Screenshot) 
    a) Loan is excluded in Edit Page, and is correctly reflected 
        in "Total Monthly Payment Less Exclusions" field 
    b) When saved in Detail Page, reverts to the original Monthly 
        Payment amount (the excluded amount is still included) 

2. Rejection Reason (Latest Application) 
    >> Update the format of field name for a cleaner UI 

3. Adverse Record Mitigation 
    App 183347, CB ID 160085 
    App 183580, CB ID 160371 
    App 183458, PB ID 160205
    a) Matched CMAP/BAP Record in Credit Verification. Even 
        if unmatched, the record is displayed. But should only 
        display matched record. Consider also the possibility that 
        initially MATCHED by User but reverted to HIT because that 
        was an error encountered before reported in GC (may be a 
        recurred issue)
    b) BAP and CMAP Tables 
        [1] Upload COFP. There is no provision to upload the 
             COFP (Certificate of Full Payment) - but this is 
             mandatory when User is "confirming" that record has 
             been mitigated. In MPI wireframe, supposedly there is 
             another column to upload the proof. But during 
             discussion, BNext explained it is not possible, hence, 
             the proposed approach was to have an identifier or ID 
             (or any equivalent) for each record, and another table 
             or page (or something like that) linked to that identifier 
             or ID where the proof is required to be uploaded. 
        [2] Findings under Related Parties - Matched records 
             under Related Parties are not shown in the page 
             (App 184055) 
        [3] Findings under Business Name of Indiv Borrower. 
             Cannot validate because File Check for Business Name 
             under Indiv Borrower is not working (but this is already 
             present in MVP1)
    c) Adverse Record Mitigation-BAP NFIS 
        >> In Adverse Loan, Bank Check, and Card Cancelled 
            - Issues are: 
            [1] Data is present in File Check Report, but missing in 
                 Credit Verification table 
            [2] Field column is present in Credit Verification table, 
                 but is not applicable 
            [3] Field column is missing in Credit Verification table 
            [4] Details are indicated in Expected Results 
    c) Adverse Record Mitigation-CMAP 
        [1] The "With COFP" column is missing (but is existing in 
              the BAP-NFIS table)
        [2] CMAP-Court Case. The DATE in the fetched record is 
             the Application Date. But it should display CMAP Date 
        [3] CMAP-Accounts Referred to Lawyers. The columns 
        "Status" and "Remarks" (part of record in IDE File Check 
         Report) are missing in the table 
        [4] Returned Checks and Telecoms Data. Have yet to see 
             sample account (will share once available). But we 
             assume not in order also noting the issues raised above

4. Action Buttons in Detail Page 
    >> These action buttons are displayed: 
        1. PB ID 160084: Close, Sat Ver, Unsat Ver, Edit 
        2. CB ID 160085: Close, Sat Ver, Unsat Ver, Edit 
        3. SP ID 160086: Close, Edit 

5. Credit Verification (Globe Icon)
    >> In the Detail Page, its hyperlinked and will direct User to 
        the Edit Page. This allows the User to edit after DSCR is 
        generated

6. Display of ETB Loan and Auto Application Records in 
    Verification
    a) Match in Borrower 360 and with Auto Loan Record but not
        displayed in Loan Info Table. To highlight, we noted 
        inconsistencies in display - which increases possibility that 
        fix may be inconsis

        CIF/TU".

    a) PB ID 160084 (CIF A132755) 
        [1] Verification Type CIF: 
             (a) Residence Address - though address is clearly lifted 
                  from MPI360 Residence Address, some differences  
                  are noted:
                  (1) MPI360 Concatenated Address: BRGY 041005107 
                       BATANGAS CITY BATANGAS 
                       >> The 41005107 in MPI360 refers to LOV Code 
                            for Barangay = TABANGAO AMBULONG with 
                            Zip Code 4200. Should display Barangay  
                            Name in MPI360 since LOV Code is present in 
                            both Datamart and Application

                       actually refers to MOB Active Deposit

            a) Row is displayed but incorrect. There is no "alternate" 
                information to be displayed. The only "alternate" in

                Hence, this "Alternate" row is not applicable.

                copied the same details as Verification Type: CIF but 
                shoud not)

    b) CB ID 160085 (CIF B078313), Borrower360 is MATCH.

        But there should be fetched details because ETB account
    c) SP ID 160086 (CIF D050749), Borrower360 is MATCH.

        is fetched, it displays error message "No Record Found". 
        But there should be fetched details

details:
Process: Verification Flow 
**The issues noted here are difficult to explain, so please make 
   an effort to replicate so you better understand the pain points
**For screenshots: if not uploaded in Case Portal, refer to Excel 
  UAT Report Batch 03B #10 for the error message

1. Saving Loan Information for Multi-Borrower Application
    a) The first step is for the User is to save the Credit 
        Verification (globe icon) of each Borrower Record. Once 
        all are done, only then can User save Credit Verification in 
        SAT/UNSAT status. So User will reopen the Credit 
        Verification page of each Borrower again, lands on Detail 
        Page again, then click NEXT to go to the Edit Page to save 
        the SAT/UNSAT. Then click NEXT again, land on Borrower 
        List Page, select next Borrower and repeat the same steps. 
        If this sounds confusing to read - then its more confusing 
        for Users to appreciate as they will surely see this as 
        repetitive and unnecessary actions 
    b) Discussed with Nilabh how to simplify this series of User 
        actions, but he highlighted that system limitation already. 
    c) But letting go of the issue will also backfire as we are sure 
        Users will complain about this - and when this reaches 
        Management, will put the project team on the spot. Hence, 
        if this is indeed system limitation, then find an alternative 
        to lessen the confusion on the part of User so we can 
        likewise justify for allowing such workflow design. Our 
        insights are in Expected Results.

2. Moving from Credit Verification Detail Page to Edit Page 
    a) User is done saving the Credit Verification (Globe Icon) of 
        all Borrowers, and the User now needs to move to 
        Edit Page to rate SAT/UNSAT.
    b) From Borrower List Page, he selects Borrower and clicks 
        NEXT. System displays the Credit Verification Detail Page. 
        User clicks NEXT - but nothing is happening - no reaction 
        from system whatsover. 
    c) User clicks NEXT again, still no system reaction. Now User 
        clicks multiple times already out of frustration, then 
        suddenly system moves to Credit Verification Edit Page 
    d) Why did the system not move to Credit Verification Page
        after the first click?

3. Unknown Error 
    a) Done updating the Credit Verification, and is already in 
        the last Borrower. When NEXT button in Credit Verification 
        Detail Page is clicked, system displays "Unknown Error". 
    b) When clicked NEXT again, system displays "Unable to 
        process your request, please try again." And succeeding 
        clicks of NEXT button just displays this error message. 
    c) When you close the error message and re-open the Update 
        Verification insight card, you will see that Verification 
        Type already moved to Residence/Employment/Business. 
    d) See Issue Screenshot 

3. Display of Borrower List Page for Multi-Borrower 
    Application when Moving to Next Verification Type 
    a) Following the normal sequence of how they assess 
        accounts, User completed the CREDIT of PB first, then CB, 
        then SP. 
    b) Tester selected PB first, completed the required actions 
        in Credit Verification Page, then clicked NEXT. Tester is 
        redirected back to Borrower List Page where she chooses 
        the next Borrower. 
    c) Tester selected CB next, completed the required actions 
        in Credit Verification Page, then clicked NEXT. Tester is 
        redirected back to Borrower List Page where she chooses 
        the next Borrower. 
    d) Tester selected SP last, completed the required actions 
        in Credit Verification Page, then clicked NEXT. Tester is 
        directed to the Residence Verification Page already 
        instead of Borrower List Page 
    e) Issue: After completing the Credit Verification of all 
        Borrowers, i
subject: HIGH: VERIFICATION PROCESS | Process: Verification FlowFunctional-Others

details:
Process: Link to Portal 

1. Sub-Dealer. Unclear how the add portal details for Sub-Dealer 
    will be executed. In the Modify Link to Portal button, fields 
    are for Parent Dealer only. These portal fields are: 
    a) Portal Originating Branch 
    b) Portal Originating Officer 
    c) Portal Processing Officer 
    d) Portal Application Owner 

2. Parent Dealer. In Modify Link to Portal button, the 
    mandatory fields are required. 
    a) This assumes that when Parent Dealer is linked to portal, 
        automatically there will be Originating Branch, 
        Originating Officer and Application Owner 
    b) But must consider that portal assignment can be given to 
        either Parent Dealer or Sub-Dealer 
    c) Hence, our suggestion, have another mandatory field 
        Portal for Parent Dealer. 
        [1] If YES, then display the mandatory tag 
        [2] If NO, allow User to save 

Expected Result:
Process: Portal Fields for Sub-Dealer 

1. Sub-Dealer. BNext to provide details how the portal fields 
    for sub-dealer will be populated 

2. Parent Dealer. Add new field Portal for Parent Dealer   
    [1] Place the field below the Link to Portal field 
    [2] Field is mandatory 
    [3] LOV - YES or NO 
    [4] If YES, these fields become mandatory 
         a) Portal Originating Branch 
         b) Portal Originating Officer 
         c) Portal Application Owner 
     [5] If NO, the fields enumerated above will not be mandatory"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Layout: Dealer Profile (Edit Page) 

1. CASA Number 
    a) Requires 11 digits even if Disbursement is CTA Other Bank. 
        But should not be because number of digits of Other Bank 
        Accounts can be below 11 digits 
    b) Allows more than 11 digits even if Disbursement is CTA. 
        In case of misencoding, this will create error in Auto Loan 
        disbursement later on as SIBS requires 11 digits for CASA 
        if CTA disbursement 
    c) The CASA Number validation should run against the 
        Disbursement field

Expected Result:
Section: Dealer Profile  
Tab: Key Information (Edit Page)

1. If Disbursement = CTA 
    CASA Number = restricted to 11 digits (will not allow above 
    or below 11 digits) 

2. If Disbursement = CTA Other Bank 
    CASA Number = allows between 1 to 40 digits

details:
Showstopper | Process: Sent for Approval 

1. Scenario: Update an existing approved Dealer (existing in 
    MVP1). It will go through approval process. This is to ensure 
    system is ready to handle surge in Dealer updating which we 
    expect will happen after cutover 

2. Dealer: FREEPORT AUTOMOTIVE CORPORATION 
    a) LO Action: 
        [1] Update the details and saved it in DRAFT status 
        [2] Transferred to LCH (via the button) 
    b) LCH Action (ID SPIO01690) 
        [1] In Edit Page, selected the status SENT FOR APPROVAL 
        [2] Selected 4 Approvers - Auto Head, Fraud, Product 
             Officer and Sales Support Officer 
        [3] Clicked SAVE 
        [4] System displayed validation: You are not allowed to  
             save the record in the selected state "Sent for 
             Approval." 
        [5] The record is under Urdaneta Originating Branch, 
             hence we thought it can be handled using role of 
             Urdaneta LCH (SPIO01492). 
        [6] Under Urdaneta LCH, opened the record and executed 
             the steps to update status to to SENT FOR APPROVAL. 
             Same error was displayed upon saving the record 

3. For supporting images, see Issue Screenshot  
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch 08A #22

Process: Sent for Approval

    approved Dealer (where status was changed to DRAFT and

details:
Layout: Accreditation Summary, Dealer Profile (Detail Page)  

1. We observed that field placement in Dealer Detail Page 
    under PA role has differences with that under LCH. 

2. These are the comparisons done, all with differences
    a) PA Role: New Draft Dealer vs New Approved Dealer vs 
        Existing Approved Dealer 
    b) LCH Role: New Draft Dealer vs New Approved Dealer vs 
        Existing Approved Dealer 
    c) Same New Draft Dealer: PA Role vs LCH Role 
    d) Same New Approved Dealer: PA Role vs LCH Role 
    e) Same Existing Approved Dealer: PA Role vs LCH Role 

3. Initially identifed as root cause:
    a) Dealer Code - in some layout, displayed in Accreditation 
        Summary section. In some layout, displayed in Dealer 
        Profile

        layout, they are sometimes before or after certain fields

        Summary) and CASA Bank (Dealer Profile), causing some 
        fields to move
    d) Accreditation Status - inconsistently displayed 

3.These are just 2 roles. Does this mean other roles may have 
   different layouts as well? Since no viewing restriction on 
   Dealer Detail Page (except maybe FTC Encoder in case they're 
   not allowed to view which means the whole page is hidden), 
   can't you apply same layout across roles?

details:
Process: Validation when Updating Dealer Details 

1. When SSO or PO updates the Dealer Details post-approval 
    via the Update Dealer Details button, and the Expiry 
    Date is below Date Today, it displays validation: "You are 
    not allowed to select previous date while modifying Expiry 
    Date." 

2. This is displayed even if being updated is not Expiry Date. 
    But the validation should only be displayed if being updated 
    is Expiry Date, where date is before Date Today 

3. Remove the validation when being updated is Dealer Code 
    and Accreditation Status. As Dealer Code gets updated right 
    after approval, the bigger issue is Accreditation Status

4. Having such validation means: 
   a) User needs to amend Expiry Date first, even if the 
       intention is to actually disaccredit an expired dealer. 
       Amending the Expiry Date will lose the audit trail 
       supporting the disacreditation of the Dealer 
   b) Disaccreditation is also used to watchlist or blacklist a 
       Dealer. Doing so should not require User to modify the 
       Expiry Date. Must preserve the original data.
  c) Continuing or discontinuing business with an Expired Dealer 
      is a management decision. Hence, we must preserve the 
      original Expiry Date (unless we have clearance to update), 
      esp this becomes material during management reporting. 

Expected Result:
Process: Validation when Updating Dealer Details  

1. Display the validation: "You are not allowed to select 
    previous date while modifying Expiry Date." when: 
    > New Expiry Date is before Date Today 

2. Remove the requirement to update Expiry Date if being 
    modified are Dealer Code and Accreditation Status"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? details:
Process: Dealer Updating and Re-Approval (New Dealer) 
*New Dealer - means Dealer is created in LOS MVP2 

This is continuation of Excel UAT Report Batch 08A #4 
*In Prod, record will be updated multiple times. Hence please 
 make sure the steps in the other case raised were executed to 
 ensure RCA for issues below is reliable   

3. Coming from re-approval of Dealer during its first updating, 
    the Dealer will undergo second updating 
    a) LO saved Dealer in DRAFT status, then Transferred to LCH 
        > The record had rework history. But User did not change 
           Rework Details (means it might still be carrying "Rework 
           Complete" value)
    b) Under LCH, updated status to SENT FOR POST-APPROVAL 
        [1] Approver 1 field is enabled. Approver was changed 
             from Auto Finance Head to Consumer Finance Head 
        [2] Approvers 2-4 fields are disabled 
        [3] Wanted to remove Approvers 2-4, but cannot. 
        [4] The record had rework history. LCH changed Rework 
             Details from REWORK VERIFIED to BLANK
    c) In Approval Records 
        [1] With 1 Approval Record under new Approver 1: status 
             was REQUEST FOR APPROVAL 
        [2] No new Approval Records created under the other 
             Approvers. Only the old Approval Records are present 
             with status APPROVED 
    d) Hence, when CF Head approved his Approval Record, the 
        Dealer status already changed to APPROVED and ACTIVE 
        because only one Approval Record is not "Approve". Other 
        Approval Recprds all carry APPROVE status already 

Expected Result:
Process: Dealer Updating and Re-Approval (New Dealer)

3. During Dealer second and suceeding updating post-approval 
    [1] The Rework Details should be emptied 
         (1) FROM: Rework Complete --> TO:: Blank 
         (2) FROM: Rework Verified --> TO: Blank 
    [2] Under SENT FOR APPROVAL status, Approvers 1-4 fields 
         should be emptied. 
    [3] Build validation where changing status from APPROVED 
         to DRAFT will require selection of Approvers (can be 
         same or different from previous Approver) and result to 
         creation of new Approval Records 
    [4] Build validation where old APPROVED Approval Records, 
         which resulted to the updating of status to DEALER 
         APPROVED, will not be overwritten. It should be preserved 
         as part of Audit trail.  
    [5] Other validation, based on BNext assessment, to ensure 
         the process during updating of approved Dealer mimics 
         that of initial Dealer approval"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Process: Dealer Updating and Re-Approval (New Dealer) 
*New Dealer - means Dealer is created in LOS MVP2

Scenario: User and system actions (Dealer Name: FEG)
1. New dealer created in LOS. During review, approval process: 
    a) Reworked by LCH via Transfer to LO/PO 
    b) Selected 4 Approvers - roles are AFH, Fraud, PO, SSO 
    c) Approved by 3 Approvers, reworked by 1 Approver 
    d) LO Rework Action: Once done, selected Rework Complete 
        > Can still edit fields even if saved as Rework Complete  
    e) LCH Rework Action: Once done, selected Rework Verified 
        [1] Approver fields are disabled, cannot change Approvers 
        [2] Approval Records updated to Rework Done 
    f) Approval Records approved by 4 Approvers 
        > Dealer status updated to APPPROVED and ACTIVE 
2. Will update Dealer details - to mirror actual recoding updating 
    requirements in PROD post-approval  
    a) LO saved Dealer in DRAFT status, then Transferred to LCH 
        > The record had rework history. But User did not change 
           Rework Details (means it might still be carrying "Rework 
           Complete" value 
    b) Under LCH, updated status to SENT FOR POST-APPROVAL 
        [1] Approver 1 field is enabled 
        [2] Approvers 2-4 fields are disabled 
        [3] Retained Approver 1. Wanted to remove Approvers 
             2-4 because this is just updating, but cannot. 
        [4] The record had rework history. But User did not  
             change Rework Details (means it might still be 
             carrying "Rework Verified" value
    c) In Approval Records 
        [1] With new Approval Record under Approver 1: status 
             was REQUEST FOR APPROVAL 
        [2] No new Approval Record under Approvers 2-4. While 
             the previous Approval Records changed to REWOK 
             DONE 

Expected Result:
Process: Dealer Updating and Re-Approval (New Dealer)

1. During the initial approval process: 
    [1] During rework and User selected REWORK COMPLETE, 
         the edit fields should already be disabled. This mirrors 
         the TRANSFER TO LCH features. 
    [2] Since Approvers cannot be changed anymore, make the 
         Approver Reassignment feature present in Approval Page 
         - View Panel (currently present in Admin role) available to 
         Product Officer and Sales Support Officer 

2. During Dealer updating post-approval 
    [1] The Rework Details should be emptied - as it clearly 
         affected the Approval Records
         (1) FROM: Rework Complete --> TO:: Blank 
         (2) FROM: Rework Verified --> TO: Blank 
    [2] Under SENT FOR APPROVAL status, Approvers 1-4 fields 
         should be emptied. As this is record updating, which can 
         happen 1month, 1year, 2years, 3years after approval, 
         then we cannot expect that Approvers will be same 
    [3] Build validation where changing status from APPROVED 
         to DRAFT will require selection of Approvers (can be 
         same or different from previous Approver) and result to 
         creation of new Approval Records 
    [4] Build validation where old APPROVED Approval Records, 
         which resulted to the updating of status to DEALER 
         APPROVED, will not be overwritten. It should be preserved 
         as part of Audit trail.  
    [5] Other validation, based on BNext assessment, to ensure 
         the process during updating of approved Dealer mimics 
         that of initial Dealer approval"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Layout: Individual Related Parties (Detail Page) 

This is related to Excel UAT Report Batch 08A #23

1. As we are encountering mapping or display error from Edit to 
    Detail Page for data encoded in tables (raised in Excel UAT 
    Report Batch 08A #21, we assume that the issues raised in 
    Edit Page are also exisitng in Detail Page 

2. Maiden Name. Should have a field where Maiden Name is     
    displayed. Make it static in the page so the other fields will 
    not move in case without Maiden Name

3. Remove / hide the fields enumerated below as they are not 
    required. Unless BNext informs us otherwise 
    [1] Civil Status                    [4] Mobile Number
    [2] Complete Address          [5] Contact Number
    [3] Contact Type            

4. If you copied the approach in Auto Application where only 
    Related Party highlights are shown in the Detail Page, and 
    need to click the hyperlinked Related Party ID to view the 
    full page, then follow the field placement in Expected 
    Results as this accounted for the removal of the fields 
    mentioned above (which is possibly existing currently) 

5. And if indeed you copied the approach in Auto Application, 
    then consider merging also the Indiv and Non-Indiv Related 
    Parties in one object, where the data highlights are as 
    enumerated below and follows this order:
    [1] Related Party ID 
    [2] Related Party Type

Navigate to the Accounts object.

Enable the Three Dots (Action) link.
Open a customer with CIS  00001002389123.

details:
Problem Statement
 
We have created quick links and configured access permissions based on roles. However, the quick link is still visible to roles for which access has not been granted. We have tried repeatedly assigning and removing permissions for the affected role, but the quick link continues to appear for that role.

Login Credentials
Dev URL : //s3.businessbywire.com/appdev/login/login user product keres@05 Database Detail : 192.168.5.89 5432 postgres postgres Database businessnext_rhb

Steps to Reproduce
Log in to the application and navigate to the Summary page.
From the left-hand menu bar, click on Quick Link Settings.
Locate the quick link named “Individual Customers Search” and open it in Edit mode.
Verify that the role “CCC Service Agent (Voice My)" does not have access to this quicklink.
Change the user role to “CCC Service Agent (Voice My)".
Navigate back and check the available quick links.
subject: RHB || Access Permission on Quick link not working as expected

details:
Hey team, 

Recently we got reports from the team that the MRMs search feature is show Authorized signers that are no longer on the Account that is shown. In my attached example Joshua Cade is showing as Authorized signer on account 7164645 when searching for his name in the top search bar. When you click on that account though he should not be on the account as he was removed some time back. The correct information is showing when in the account in MRM and Symitar, only the search feature is inaccurate.

Can we get assistance into seeing why the search feature is populating Account information that the member is no longer on?

Thank you!
subject: Member Name Showing In Search For Accounts That They Are No Longer On

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Country (Indiv-Edit) 

1. If "Address Type" = PH or if "Do you want to add PH address" 
    = YES, the Country field is not consistently populated with 
    PHILIPPINES. But it should be. 

2. We observed its existing in: 
    a) Update Borrower: PB Main Residence Address  
        > But not existing in CB and SP
    b) Update Borrower: PB Main Employment/Business Address 
        > But not existing in CB and SP
    c) Update Borrower: PB,CB,SP Additional Residence Address 
    d) Update Borrower: PB,CB,SP Additional Employment / 
        Business Address 
    e) Add Borrower: Additional Residence Address 
        > But not existing in Main Residence Address
    f) Add Borrower: Additional Employment/Business Address 
        > But not existing in Main Employment/Business Address
    g) Additional SOI: PB,CB,SP Employment and Business 

3. This is to highlight the inconsistencies in the pages depemding 
    if record is PB,CB,SP, if its main or additional address, or if 
    its Update Borrower or Add Borrower Page 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Country 
Record: Borrower, Additional SOI (Edit Page)

1. The Country field should be disabled and auto-populated with 
    PHILIPPINES if: 
    a) Address Type = PH 
    b) Do you want to Add PH Address = YES
    
2. Apply in:
    a) Indiv Borrower 
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB,SP
             (1) Main Residence Address 
             (2) Additional Residence Address 
             (3) Main Employment/Business Address 
             (4) Additional Employment/Business Address
        [2] Add Borrower Page 
             (1) Main Residence Address 
             (2) Additional Residence Address 
             (3) Main Employment/Business Address 
             (4) Additional Employment/Business Address 
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower 
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB
             (1) Main Business Address 
             (2) Additional Business Address
        [2] Add Borrower Page 
             (1) Main Business Address 
             (2) Additional Business Address 
   c) Additional SOI under Indiv Borrower of PB,CB,SP
       [1] Employment - Address
       [2] Business - Address 
   d) Additional SOI under Non-Indiv Borrower of PB,CB
       [1] Business - Address"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? Steps to Reproduce

Search for Case  00283479.

Go to the Attachments tab.

Locate the uploaded .txt file.

Click on the three-dot menu and select View.

Observe that the preview is not available.

(Same issue occurs for .xml files as well.)

Login Credentials

details:
I have a used case where we have an external system creating and updating leads in CRM. The explanation is as given 
1) CRM Lead Creation API is called by external system and lead is created in New status code.
2) In client's system there are multiple webpages to update the data of the said lead, so the system calls CRM lead update API multiple times for each page to update the lead data on New' status code itself. 
3) At one point if the client system provides 'Submitted' field with 'true' value' the record should be updated to 'Interested' status code.
We tried to update the lead through autoflow by placing a 'decision' to check the field value; or through BER and Update trigger to update the lead. Both the approaches are not working.
subject: Record is not updated through autoflow or update BER/trigger option

Custom field should be created.

details:
P2 |  Maybank Translator Action and External Binding Input param field mapping is getting resetted for Check type 
 
 Verification
When translator action is saved first time - correct field mapping gets stored. When translator action is edited for changes then field mapping gets removed automatically and default value as False gets reset under mapping. This is resulting into misbehaving trigger action function. Wrong value is getting passed to EDS.


1. Login - Administrator Role
2. GO to Setup - Translator -> Translator Action
3. Add new Translator Action -> Select required EDS -> Select fields mapping with Check Type (Type =10) under input param mapping.
4. Save the trigger 
5. Edit the samee Translator Action and modify some details or change any input param mapping.. 
6. Save the Translator Action again
7. Open the same again and check input param mapping
 

Mapping is getting reset to False

Mapping should not be reset in any case.

Same is applicable to External Binding where default value as False is getting saved if edited and saved again.
Observed only for fields of Check Type.
 
 

MPI_ //m2.businessbywire.com/appmaysa/login/login

 MPI_SA_DB
 192.168.0.36
 crmnext abc123
 
User 
losadmin
subject: P2 | Maybank Translator Action and External Binding Input param field mapping is getting reset for Check type

details:
DETAILS:
Process: QDE Done Error Message 

1. Raised in Excel UAT Report Batch A #22 the error message 
    encountered when saving Borrower in QDE Done. The error 
    message encountered is "Unknown Error". Once you refresh 
    the page, status / details are saved in QDE Done. This 
    happens when: 
    a) Updating Borrower status from PQDE to QDE Done 
    b) Updating Borrower details while in QDE Done 

2. Tester encountered another error in QDE Done while saving 
    Borrower Record. 
    a) Application Status was already QDED. She initiated Update 
        Borrower and was encoding Additional PH Address (in 
        Occupation and Income). 
    b) Error Message is: "Unable to process your request, please 
        try again."
    c) She closed the message and refreshed the page, the 
        additional PH address she encoded was captured in Detail 
        Page. So she was certain this was not a case of lapsed 
        session. 

3. Since the message are different from what was reported 
    earlier, then logging as defect in case another issue caused 
    the display of this new error message 

4. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
    *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
     uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F, #192

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: QDE Done Error Message 

1. When updating status to QDE Done or when saving changes
    while in QDE Done, there should be no error message and 
    there should be no need to refresh the page before Record 
    is saved. 
    > Perform RCA and apply the fix permanently 

2. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower: PB,CB,SP 
        [1] Update Borrower
        [2] Add Borrower 
        [3] Additional SOI-Employment 
        [4] Additional SOI-Business 
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower: PB,CB (SP not mentioned because
        there should be no Non-Indiv SP) 
        [1] Update Borrower
        [2] Add Borrower 
        [3] Additional SOI-Business"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Process: Loan Details - System-Computed Values

1. As agreed and as expected, there should be validation that 
    will restrict the Application from being updated to next 
    status if any of the system-computed field did not compute 

2. But in Apps 181990 and 181704, the EY was 0 and it reached 
    Pre-Booking stage. These applications have EYs now, either 
    it was manually maintained backend so the booking can 
    proceed or it was resolved at the time of reporting. 

3. Testers also observed fields below are not auto-computed 
    when they are changing values while in Unit Edit Page
    a) Total Tuck-Ins 
    b) Other Deferred Credit Interest

4. Additionally, since EIR (or Annual EIR - as explained in Excel 
    UAT Report Batch E - #148, #149, #158) is not yet in place, 
    we cannot test if the validation will fire in case system-
    computation does not work.

5. Reporting as defect to ensure that the fix applied is 
    permanent and that it will cover EIR computation also. This 
    is also to remind that validation should be in place where 
    Application is restricted from moving forward if any system-
    computation failed to work. 

APP ID:
181990 
181704

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Loan Details - System-Computed Values
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

1. There are 2 kinds of system-computations:         
    a) One that happens while in Unit Edit Page. 
         > This represents all system-computed fields except the
            4 fields enumerated below.
    b) One that happens after saving the Unit Edit Page. As
        inquired with Akash via WhatsApp, these are the fields: 
        [1] EY 
        [2] Simple Interest Rate 
        [3] IRR - to be called Monthly EIR 
        [4] EIR - to be called Annual EIR 
          
2. For system-computed fields that happens while in Unit Edit 
    Page - restrict the Unit from being saved if any system-
    computation did not work 

3. For system-computed fields that happens after saving the 
    Unit Edit Page - restrict the Application from being updated 
    to next status if any system-computation did not work. This 
    validation must be present even in status codes where being 
    updated is the Borrower (e.g. from PQDE to QDED and from 
    PFDE to FDED). 

4. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s 
    [3] All status codes where system-computation is triggered - 
         PQDE, QDED, PFDE, FDED, Amendments (in Post-
         Approval), and Pre-Booking (only for the Monthly and 
         Annual EIR)"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? If yes, what & provide list of Missing Scripts(Results of CRMnext_PS_Activity procedure)?:7) Share entries from schema log for changes done before the issue has been reported8) Enable itemlogging for one user and share logs for impacted record."

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Creation of Multiple Unit Records - Part 2
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

This is continuation of excel UAT Report-Batch E, #157

3. The Fill Data Manually field seems useless now. 
    a) Our understanding was this was developed to make 
        multiple Unit record creation convenient for User.
    b) This field created new problem where mandatory fields 
        remain blank at stages where they should be mandatory. 
    c) This was reported in excel UAT Report Batch A, #s 17 
        and 43 (not sure of the Case IDs if you are reading from 
        the Portal), which continues to be unresolved. 
    d) This is contrary to what was committed and agreed to 
        resolve Audit issues. We note that when adding unit in 
        Proceed to FDE and FDE Done, the mandatory fields are 
        in place regardless if Fill Data Manually is YES or NO 
    e) But while in Proceed to QDE and QDE Done, the 
        mandatory fields can be blank because of the Fill Data 
        Manually. Hence, must update the approach to ensure 
        mandatory Unit fields are properly enforced 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Creation of Multiple Unit Records - Part 2 

1. Prerequisite: Resolve the issue in excel UAT Report 
    Batch E, #156, where the created Unit Records via the 
    Number of Units field must contain same details in all filled 
    or populated fields 

Once the prerequisite is handled:

2. In Fill Data Manually field, set the value as YES then hide 
    in front-end UI. No way for front-end User to select YES or 
    NO 

3. Permanently display the mandatory tag identifier (red 
    asterisk) in Unit Records (Edit Page), as appropriate in the 
    status code. No need to click SAVE, FINISH or NEXT to 
    display mandatory tag

Objective: Mandatory unit fields are populated at the appropriate status code - as agreed and committed to resolve Audit issues. Any alternative is unacceptable as we will not be able to close the Audit finding until we deliver our commitment."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? If yes, what & provide list of Missing Scripts(Results of CRMnext_PS_Activity procedure)?:7) Share entries from schema log for changes done before the issue has been reported8) Enable itemlogging for one user and share logs for impacted record."

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Total Tuck-Ins Amount and Other Loan Details

1. Total Tuck-Ins Amount is auto-computed in Edit Page but is 
    not displayed in Detail Page. This shows another weakness in 
    system design. If this happened in Total Tuck-Ins, what is 
    our assurance that display issue will not happen to other 
    system-computed fields while in Edit Page - lifted from how 
    Audit assesses such issues 

2. Related to issue raised in Excel UAT Report Batch E #164 
    (please make sure to read this), this means it is insufficient 
    to just have a validation in Edit Page for system-computed 
    fields while in Edit Page. There has to be a validation also 
    in Detail Page because display errors happen. We cannot 
    always hit 100% all scenarios in UAT, hence there has to be 
    additional layer of control.  

APP ID: 182206

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Total Tuck-Ins Amount and Other Loan Details  
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

1. There are 2 kinds of system-computations:         
    a) One that happens while in Unit Edit Page. 
         > This represents all system-computed fields except the
            4 fields enumerated below.
    b) One that happens after saving the Unit Edit Page. As
        inquired with Akash via WhatsApp, these are the fields: 
        [1] EY 
        [2] Simple Interest Rate 
        [3] IRR - to be called Monthly EIR 
        [4] EIR - to be called Annual EIR 
          
2. For system-computed fields that happens while in Unit Edit 
    Page, display also validation in Detail Page where fields in 
    Edit and Detail must have same value. This validation must 
    be present even in status codes where being updated is the 
    Borrower (e.g. from PQDE to QDED and from PFDE to FDED). 

3. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s 
    [3] All status codes where system-computation is triggered -

details:
Details:
Related Party File Check  

1. Applicable File Checks to Related Parties depends on 
    Effective Share or Relationship Type. 

2. If a certain File Check is not applicable to the Related Party, 
    approach used by BNext is to retain the PENDING tag. 

3. Please understand that on a User standpoint, this gives the 
    impression that File Check is still running. 

4. Procedurally, will also define PENDING as -- awaiting BAP 
    Response. Giving them 2 definition - awaiting BAP response 
    or non-credit Related Party is operationally inefficient. Under 
    the latter, we have to create another manual step for User 
    to validate if its PENDING because file check criteria not met

5. On UAT standpoint, the PENDING is also misleading - because 
    we need to ask BNEXT everytime if the PENDING means its 
    not applicable or if its REAL pending - like if system made an 
    error and it triggered a file check request.

Expected Result:
Process: Related Party File Check

1. If File Check on Related Party is not applicable, display a file 
    check output of N/APP or any equivalent that will 
    immediately inform User that its not applicable 

2. Do not use PENDING as status to describe that file check is 
    not applicable. Pending should only refer to one thing - 
    awaiting BAP response."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? details:
When we are saving the activity on Policy 360 then we are getting attached error.

    carry the "MY" in the name. This is as noted also in the 
    Dealer/Salesman 360 Process Document

    arrange as indicated in Expected Results, to include 
    additional view or exclude inapplicable view.
    a) My Dealer Approvals - contain all Dealer Approval 
        Records, pending and decided. 
    b) My Pending Dealer Approvals - we expect contains 
        Approval Records with status"Request for Approval" and 
        "Rework Done" assigned to User-Approver

       make sure. While it is easy to validate in UAT as we have 
       access to all User IDs, this is not the case in Production 
       where Users cannot access other people's User IDs

    we requested to update the name of Rework Details section

        LCH and Transfer to LO/PO Flags so other Users can see 
        if record is with LCH or with Loan Originator
    c) The details, including MPI layout, are in the Expected 
        Results of Excel UAT Report Batch 08A #33
