details:
DETAILS:
Process: Validation Message (Unable to Process Request) 

1. User (LA role) was executing Promo Code test in PQDE status 
    where she selected multiple promo codes. Upon clicking 
    NEXT, system displayed validation "Unable to process your 
    request, please try again" 
    a) The error message is very vague, User has no idea what 
        mistake she did and how to rectify. 
    b) See Issue Screenshot for reference 
        *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
         uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #170

2. Another Tester (LO role) also encountered same message, 
    encountered when she was performing Unit Data Transfer 
    and Add Unit. Images are also in Issue Screenshot.

3. If the error is due to lapsed session, then display the correct
    message, e.g."Your session has already lapsed. Please refresh 
    the page and input again your log in credentials." 

4. If the validation message has a different root cause, e.g. input 
    error c/o User, then update the validation message 

5. The concerned account App 177114 is still in PQDE status. 
    Since we have provided you the message and the App ID, we 
    assume that is sufficient to trace the root cause. Objective 
    is to remove the vagueness in validation messages so User is 
    properly guided.

APP ID: 177114

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Validation Message (Unable to Process Request)

1. Display the appropriate validation message for User guidance 
    on next action: 
    a) If due to lapsed session, display validation message: "Your 
        session has already lapsed. Please refresh the page and 
        input again your log in credentials." 
    b) If due to input error done by User, display the appropriate 
        message 
    c) Do not use vague validation message. That will also be a 
        challenge even for L1 support as its unclear what is the 
        cause.

2. Apply in:

details:
Problem Statement
The regex validation applied to a custom field is not functioning as expected.
Despite configuring the regex to allow only numeric values, the field is still accepting non-numeric characters.

Expected Behavior
The custom field should accept only numeric values (0–9) and restrict any alphabetic or special characters as per the applied regex.

Actual Behavior
The field accepts non-numeric input even after applying the numeric-only regex.

Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to the Event object.
From the Toolbox, go to Customize Page Layout.
Open the New/Edit page of the Appointment layout.
Observe that a regex is applied to the Mobile Number field.
Click on the Add button to create a new appointment.
Enter alphabetic characters in the Mobile Number field.

Login Credentials
Dev URL : //s3.businessbywire.com/appdev/login/login user product keres@05 Database Detail : 192.168.5.89 5432 postgres postgres Database businessnext_rhb

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Car Brand 

This is related to Excel UAT Report Batch C #97 

1. As agreed with Deep during Data Entry sign-off, we will 
    revisit MVP1 fields where BNext used dropdown approach 
    instead of search. This is noting the following: 
    a) We dont need all dropdown fields to be converted to 
        search. Just a few fields with very long LOV 
    b) BNext will explain if can handle. Or if not, what is the 
        difficulty

2. Main Issue: Zooming in on fields with long LOV, why some 
    are using search approach (which is the better option), 
    others are using dropdown. 

3. The Car Brand field should also utilize Search approach. 
    Currently it is not arranged alphabetically; hence User needs 
    to scroll down and read each LOV to find the required value. 
    But changing from dropdown to search field should retain 
    its current features where Brand LOVs displayed is dependent 
    on Loan Type 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Car Brand
Record: Unit (Edit Page)

1. Convert the Car Brand field from Dropdown to Search but 
    should retain its current features where Brand LOVs displayed 
    is dependent on Loan Type (e.g. if Loan Type = TRUCK, 
    displays only car brands under TRUCK)


2. Apply in: Unit Record Edit Page

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Downpayment % and PHP

1. Downpayment % should not carry a default 0 value. As this 
    is a system-computed field, it should carry value dependent 
    on Net Unit Price and Downpayment PHP 

2. We generally observe that Downpayment % is blank. But an    
    LA Tester reported that Downpayment % has 0 value despite 
    Downpayment PHP being blank. See Issue Screenshot for    
    reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #175

3. For us this means: 
    a) System-computation did not work 
    b) Downpayment %, for some reason or maybe DB exception 
        as you may call it, carried default 0.00 value

3. We dont know if the issue is a bug that BNext can still 
    resolve or not, as we somehow anticipate you will say you 
    cannot replicate the issue noting we also observe that 
    Downpayment % is initially blank. But the main concern 
    here is to ensure system-computation works and mandatory 
    validation runs properly. This is coming from Audit issues 
    where failures in mandatory tag validation even for one 
    account has been deemed as weak input control already. 
    Audit only does sampling - so their evaluation is if it 
    happened on one unit, then it may have happened to other 
    units that were not part of the sampled accounts

4. Currently, only Downpayment % is set as mandatory, which 
    followed MPI Field List 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Downpayment % and PHP
Record: Unit (Edit Page) - Loan Details 

This is related to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #174 which explained that Downpayment % must properly carry the feature of being a system-computed field

1. Set Downpayment PHP as a mandatory field (with red 
    asterisk) 
    a) Downpayment can have ?0.00 value 
    b) Mandatory starting Proceed to QDE status, and remains 
        mandatory in QDED, PFDE, FDED and succeeding status 
        codes 

2. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s 
    [3] Present in Update Unit and Add Unit pages 

Note: This is another layer of control where, in case system-computed Downpayment % did not work, there will still be a Downpayment mandatory tag validation via the Downpayment PHP field"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? If yes, what & provide list of Missing Scripts(Results of CRMnext_PS_Activity procedure)?:7) Share entries from schema log for changes done before the issue has been reported8) Enable itemlogging for one user and share logs for impacted record."
subject: UNIT RECORD | Field: Downpayment (% and PHP)Functional-Others

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Auto-Copy for Static Fields in Application Details

1. Static fields in Application Details are enumerated below, 
    where those with ** (two asterisk) signifies that they must 
    always be same for first and additional units. These fields  
    with two asterisk must be disabled under additional units 
    to prevent User from updating.  
    [1] Application Type**           [7] CA/PO
    [2] Loan Type**                     [8] Account Source**
    [3] Loan Proceeds Payee        [9] Tran Type        
    [4] Vehicle Condition**          [10] Promo Code - YES or NO
    [5] Vehicle Usage**                [11] PDA Code** - YES or NO
    [6] Unacceptable Unit** 
 
2. Related to issue raised in Excel UAT Report Batch E #166 
    (if you are reading from Case Portal, dont know the Case ID 
    for this, hence just refer to the excel file), there should be a 
    consistent design when updating Unit #1 and its impact to 
    additional units - whether Unit Data Transfer is initiated or 
    not. Please refer to the related case to understand better as 
    we provided a sample there. We cannot have different 
    behaviors for different fields under different scenarios as 
    that will be difficult for User to follow and remember 
    operationally. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Auto-Copy for Static Fields in Application Details  
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

1. These are the static fields in Application Details that must 
    ALWAYS be same for first and additional units. Under 
    additional units, the fields are disabled so User cannot edit. 
    This is observed existng in UAT UI but is indicated here to 
    highlight the difference with Expected Result #2 below
    [1] Application Type**           [6] Unacceptable Unit** 
    [2] Loan Type**                     [8] Account Source**      
    [4] Vehicle Condition**          [11] PDA Code** - YES or NO
    [5] Vehicle Usage**                
     
2. These are the static fields in Application Details that will 
    auto-copy updated details in Unit #1 to additional units. 
    Under additional units, the fields are enabled allowing User 
    to edit regardless if Unit Data Transfer was previously 
    initiated or not 
    [3] Loan Proceeds Payee        [9] Tran Type  
    [7] CA/PO                              [10] Promo Code - YES or NO
                  
3. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s 

Note: This is not intended to change the design. But simply to align it as we cannot have inconsistent system behavior. Layout: Transfer and Rework Details  

This is related to Excel UAT Report Batch 08A #30 

1. Since Loan Originator and LCH are also sharing DRAFT status, 
    it can get confusing where the record is, esp for other Users. 
    Also, on the side of LO and LCH, when they click the Transfer 
    buttons, they need a visual guide as proof that the record has 
    been sucessfully transferred 

2. Since a new section will be created for Rework status, best 
    to just merge the transfer and rework details into one 
    section: Transfer and Rework Details. 
    > Refer to MPI layout below. If you are reading this from 
      Case Portal and image is not uploaded, then refer to Excel 
      UAT Report-Batch 08A #33

Expected Result:
Section: Transfer and Rework Details 
Tab: Summary (Detail Page)

1. Create a new section Transfer and Rework Details which 
    will merge these fields: 
    a) Transfer Status - LOVs are enumerated below, all auto-
        stamped by LOS in the page 
         [1] TRANSFER TO LO/PO 
         [2] TRANSFER TO LCH  
         [3] <Blank> - field is auto-emptied once record is 
              updated to SENT FOR APPROVAL or REJECTED status
    b) Rework Status - LOVs are: 
         [1] UNDER REWORK - default value upon rework by 
              Approver 
         [2] REWORK COMPLETE - User selected (Loan Originator) 
         [3] REWORK VERIFIED - User selected (LCH) 
         [4] <Blank> - field is auto-emptied once record is 
              updated in APPROVED or REJECTED status  

2. Place the section below the Approver Details section (or 
    below the Accreditation Assessment section if Approver 
    Details is not present in the page)."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Field: Year First Reg 

1. There was a validation error "Invalid Date" in the Year First 
    Reg field (reported by FTC Encoder User). 

2. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #167 

3. We later observed that this has been corrected, as can 
    already select Year First Reg without the validation error. 
    But still reporting to ensure fix applied is permanent. 

4. Also, the field has become a dropdown field instead of input 
    field, as per MPI Field List. The dropdown showed future 
    years that are not acceptable in the field Year First Reg. If 
    the intention is to introduce input control, we agree to the 
    intention but not on the approach. Should be maintained as 
    an input field (similar with Year Model where User encodes 
    the year) but handle the control by setting upper and lower 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Year First Reg  
Record: Unit (Edit Page) - Application Details

1. Change the Year First Reg from dropdown field to input 
    field where User encodes the year 

2. Display the "Invalid Date" validation when User encodes 
    unacceptable values (e.g. inputs MMDDYYY, letters, etc.) 

3. Apply input control where: 
    a) Year Today = represents the Current Year (NOT the 
        Application Year but the Current Year)
    b) Upper Limit = Current Year. Means User can input as max 
        YYYY is the Current Year, cannot input a future year (e.g.
        if Current Year is 2026, can only input 2026 and not 2027)
    c) Lower Limit = Current Year - 30. With Admin provision 
        to change the "30" to a lower or higher number.
    d) No need for Admin to manually change the Year Today (or 
        the Current Year). It auto adjusts when the Date changes

4. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s
subject: UNIT RECORD |Field: Year First Reg

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Auto-Copy for Dynamic Fields in Application Details

1. Dynamic fields in Application Details are enumerated below. 
    These are the fields that are displayed when display 
    conditions are met - already present in the current UAT UI.
    [1] Acquisition Date             [8] Referror Name 
    [2] Elapsed Days                   [9] Actual Referror Name  
    [3] Truck Weight                  [10] Promo Code - actual code,
    [4] Year First Reg                         not the YES/NO field
    [5] Unit Min 400 CC              [11] Promo Name 
    [6] Referring Branch            [12] PDA Code - actual code
    [7] Referror User ID             [13] PDA Name 
    
2. If Multiple Unit, we observed the different auto-copy 
    behavior of dynamic fields in Application Details. 
    a) Sample 1: Truck Weight. Unit #1 is changed, the new 
        Truck Weight is auto-copied in all Additional Units,  
        observed in units where Data Copy was previously 
        triggered and not triggered. User can then modify the 
        value in the Additional Unit 

    b) Sample 2: Year First Reg, Unit #1 is changed, the new 
        Year First Reg is NOT auto-copied in Additional Units, 
        observed in units where Data Copy was previously 
        triggered and not triggered  

3. This is unacceptable as there should be one design only for 
    consistent procedural steps. It will confuse User if we have 
    different instructions for different fields under different 
    scenarios 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Auto-Copy for Dynamic Fields in Application Details  
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

1. These are the dynamic fields in Application Details, 
    displayed when Display Conditions are met.
    [1] Acquisition Date             [8] Referror Name 
    [2] Elapsed Days                   [9] Actual Referror Name  
    [3] Truck Weight                  [10] Promo Code - actual code,
    [4] Year First Reg                         not the YES/NO field
    [5] Unit Min 400 CC              [11] Promo Name 
    [6] Referring Branch            [12] PDA Code - actual code
    [7] Referror User ID             [13] PDA Name 

2. When value of dynamic fields of Unit #1 is changed, the 
    update is automatically applied to the Additional Units - 
    regardless if Unit Data Transfer was previously initiated or 
    not 

3. Excluding PDA Code and PDA Name, User has the option to 
    modify the value of other dynamic fields (#s [1] to [11] as 
    enumerated above) in Application Details of Additional 
    Units. This is an existing feature already in UAT - and should 
    be maintained.

4. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s
subject: UNIT RECORD | Process: Auto-Copy for Dynamic Fields in Application Details

    wireframe if Employment Type = P,N,G,OS,OL

             fields must follow the latest MPI wireframe

             placement in the Detail Page (latest MPI wireframe), 
             since this page organizes fields in two columns.

    c) For employment address fields - follow MPI layout. For 
        reference, you may check Additional SOI-Business as it 
        follows the correct Address layout (except that the field 
        "Unit/House Number" should just be "Unit Number"; and the 
        field "Zipcode" should be "Zip Code")

     Originators based on their interview guide, hence we are 
     being particular on this.

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Year Model

1. There is a validation message "Fill value from 1850 to 2050 in 
    Year Model" in the Year Model field. 

2. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #168 

3. If the intention is to introduce input control, we agree to the 
    intention but not on the upper and lower limits set. Explained 
    further in Expected Results 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Year Model
Record: Unit (Edit Page) - Application Details

1. Apply input control where: 
    a) Year Today = represents the Current Year (NOT the 
        Application Year but the Current Year)
    b) Upper Limit = Current Year + 2. Sample, with 2026 as 
        Current Year, User can input max 2028.
    c) Lower Limit = Current Year - 30. With Admin provision 
        to change the "30" to a lower or higher number.
    d) No need for Admin to manually change the Year Today (or 
        the Current Year). It auto adjusts when the Date changes

2. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Copy PB Residence Details 

1. When "Copy Primary Borrower Details" is checked, the 
    Residence Details of PB is auto-copied to the Residence 
    Details of CB and/or SP. 

2. When PB Residence Details is updated, as expected and based 
    on our understanding of MPV1 feature, the update is likewise 
    auto-copied without the need to resave the CB/SP Record. 

3. But in our testing (see App 181685): 
     a) Application with CB and SP, both with checked "Copy 
         Primary Borrower Details". Initially they have same 
         Residence Details
     b) Changed the address of PB, then saved it. But did not 
         resave the record of CB and SP. Their Residence Details 
         were not updated 
     c) Resaved the record of CB. That's when the Residence 
         Details got updated 

4. The intention of Residence Details auto-copy is to mimimize 
    User action for Borrowers who reside in same address. Hence, 
    the checked auto-copy should suffice for system to always 
    auto-copy the details - including updates 

APP ID: 181685

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Copy PB Residence Details 

1. When "Copy Primary Borrower Details" is checked, the 
    Residence Details of PB is auto-copied to the Residence 
    Details of CB and/or SP (existing feature) 

2. When PB Residence details is updated, the updates will be 
    auto-copied to the CB or SP (where the copy PB details is in 
    place) without the need to resave the CB or SP record 
    (feature to be fixed)

3. Apply in: 
    > Indiv Borrower Record - PB,CB,SP (Edit Page)
subject: BORROWER RECORD | Process: Copy PB Residence Details

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Zip Code  

1. Unlike REGION which is disabled and auto-populated based 
    on BARANGAY, CITY, and PROVINCE, even in MVP1 we have 
    already questioned the approach used in ZIP CODE  

2. We understand the Address follows a hierarchy. But same 
    with REGION, ZIP CODE is also unique. There can be no 2 ZIP 
    CODE for one Barangay-City-Province data set.

3. But currently, User still needs to select the ZIP CODE even if 
    there's always just one value. This is being compared with 
    GDS where ZIP CODE is auto-populated the moment 
    Barangay-City-Province is populated 

4. Bottomline, we expect it is same as REGION where field is 
    disabled and auto-populated based on Barangay-City-Province. 
    This is as noted also in Field List  

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Zip Code  
Record: Indiv | Non-Indiv Borrower (Edit Page) 

1. Zip Code must be auto-populated based on Barangay-City-
    Province

2. Apply in: All Address fields in Edit Page -
    [1] Indiv Borrower - PB,CB,SP 
         in Update Borrower and Add Borrower pages 
         a) Residence Address 
         b) Alternate/Additional Address - PH 
         c) Business Address - PH 
         d) Additional Business Address - PH 
    [2] Non-Indiv Borrower - PB,CB (Non-Ind should not be an SP) 
         in Update Borrower and Add Borrower pages  
         a) Business Address - PH 
         b) Additional Business Address - PH 
    [3] Additional Source of Income 
         a) Update SOI - Update Employment, Update Business 
         b) Add SOI - Add Employment, Add Business"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Layout: Residence - Additional Address (Edit Page) 

1. In Additional Residence Address, did not follow the required 
    field placement and layout 

2. We designed additional address to be in a tabular form. But 
    BNext approach is Data Object Bank (unsure if this is the 
    correct name). 
    a) This is not preferred because when saved in Edit Page, 
        the data is in vertical form instead of horizontal. It is 
        inconvenient to User. 
    b) The data is just in one column, so it extends the page 
    c) As it is, address fields are also not in proper order. But 
        will no longer be highlighted in Expected Results since we 
        prefer the tabular approach as noted below. 

3. Revert to the original requirement. You can create 2 
    +ADD NEW buttons - one for PH and one for non-PH address, 
    which is same with our wireframe. With validation that can 
    only encode max 3 additional residence address 
    (combined PH and non-PH) 

4. The table approach which was the original design in both 
    wireframes created by BNext and MPI was perfectly okay 

5. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F, #217 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Section: Additional Residence Address
Record: Indiv Borrower (Edit) 

1. Use Table Approach when encoding additional PH and non-PH 
    Residence Address 
    a) Can add, edit, delete the address, including if encoded 
        in earlier status code and updated in later status code. 
        Sample, if additional address was encoded in QDED, then 
        it can be deleted in QDED, PFDE, or FDED status  
    b) Have 2 add buttons - one for PH and non-PH 
    c) With validation that can only encode max 3 additional 
        address (combined for PH and Non-PH) 
    d) Lookout: Under tabular form, ensure that mandatory fields 
        are tagged accordingly (with *)

2. Follow MPI layout below for display order of field columns.
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F #217"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Field: Downpayment % 

1. When Downpayment PHP is ?0.00, the Downpayment % 
    remains blank. But following the system-computation 
    design, it should carry the value 0.00% 

2. Having Downpayment ?0.00 is acceptable, this means we 
    will finance the full Unit Price - under deviation approval. 
    We have done this before as a campaign though was 
    discontinued during pandemic years. But this is a feature 
    that must be maintained. 

3. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #174

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Downpayment % 
Record: Unit (Edit Page) - Loan Details 

1. Downpayment %, being a system-computed field, should 
    carry value based on Net Unit Price and Downpayment Php 

2. Since Net Unit Price will always have a value above ?0.00, 
    then the main determinant of Downpayment % is the 
    Downpayment PHP 
    a) If Downpayment PHP = Blank, Downpayment % = Blank 
    b) If Downpayment PHP = ?0.00, Downpayment % = 0.00% 
    c) If Downpayment PHP > ?0.00, Downpayment % > 0.00% 

3. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided?         blank.

       mandatory tag (the identifier red asterisk)

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Delete Feature 

1. It was observed in Contact Number that: 
    a) First encoded contact number cannot be deleted 
    b) Can delete the contact details at point of encoding. 
        Meaning, right after encoding it, he has the option to 
        delete it. But once saved or once it has been updated to 
        next status code, it cannot be deleted it anymore 

2. Since BNext can put this kind of control, then the control 
    should be when the Borrower is saved in Initiate Verification 
    as that concludes the Data Entry part 

3. But while in Data Entry, given its name is Data Entry which 
    means application is still at the stage where data is being 
    completed, then he should have the provision to add, edit, 
    delete - and that happens in the whole Data Entry stage 

4. It just so happened that following system construct, you 
    created 5 Data Entry status codes. But process-wise, we are
    still in the Data Entry stage. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Delete Feature 

1. User should be able to add, edit, and delete encoded data at 
    any Data Entry status code, from IDE to FDE Done. 

2. Given that, these tables / objects should have the delete 
    button from IDE to FDE Done - where he can delete data 
    including those he added in earlier status codes (e.g. added in 
    IDE, can delete in QDE Done). 
    a) Indiv Borrower 
        [1] ID Details 
        [2] Additional Residence Address 
        [3] Additional Employment / Business Address 
        [4] Contact Details (Number)
        [5] Accounts 
        [6] References 
        [7] Identified Deviation
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower 
        [1] ID Details                            
        [2] Additional Business Address 
        [3] Indiv Related Parties 
        [4] Non-Indiv Related Parties 
        [5] Contact Details (Number)
        [6] Contact Person 
        [7] Accounts 
        [8] References 
        [9] Identified Deviation

3. Note that if User deleted all data, but system requires one, 
    then the validation should still run. 
    > Sample: All Contact Number is deleted in FDE Done. But at 
       least one Mobile Number is required. This means upkn 
       saving, validation will fire requiring input of one Mobile 
       Number

3. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower - PB,CB,SP Edit Page 
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower - PB,CB Edit Page"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? Additional Employment / Business Address (Indiv-Edit)

    the required field placement and layout

    BNext approach is Data Object Bank (unsure if this is the 
    correct name). 
    a) This is not preferred because when saved in Edit Page, 
        the data is in vertical form instead of horizontal. It is 
        inconvenient to User. 
    b) The data is just in one column, so it extends the page 
    c) As it is, address fields are also not in proper order. But 
        will no longer be highlighted in Expected Results since we 
        prefer the tabular approach as noted below.

    +ADD NEW buttons - one for PH and one for non-PH address, 
    which is same with our wireframe. With validation that can 
    only encode max 3 additional employment/business address 
    (combined PH and non-PH)

    wireframes created by BNext and MPI was perfectly okay

details:
DETAILS:
Actions: Status Code as Search Filter 

1. "Sent To" vs "Assign To". These status codes are still named 
     Sent To, but should already be Assign To. The status code 
     names must be consistent 
     a) Sent to Lending Centre 
     b) Sent to Product Officer 
     c) Sent to Sales Support Officer 
     d) Sent to Approver 

2. "Booked" Status Code. We observed that there are 2 Booked 
    status codes present in the dropdown. This is noted under 
    Processing Officer access role, but not sure if this is same for 
    other access roles
    a) Should only have one "Booked" in the dropdown
    b) See Issue Screenshot for reference. If you are reading 
        this from Case Portal and image is not uploaded, then 
        refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #173 

3. Loan Disbursed. This status code is missing in the dropdown. 
    This is noted under Processing Officer access role, but not 
    sure if this is same for other access roles 

4. Sent for Review (Post-Booking). This may have been an old 
    status code under the first versions of MVP1. As far as we 
    know, we dont have this status code now. But BNext knows 
    best in case this is being utilized for something else - but we 
    need to know its purpose as currently we dont know what 
    this is for. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Actions: Status Code as Search Filter

1. Update these status code names:
     a) FROM: Sent to Lending Centre 
         TO: Assign to Lending Centre (or Assign to LCH if still 
               possible as that should have been the correct name. 
               Lending Centre is a place, LCH or Lending Center 
               Head is a person)
     b) FROM: Sent to Product Officer 
         TO: Assign to Product Officer 
     c) FROM: Sent to Sales Support Officer  
         TO: Assign to Sales Support Officer 
     d) FROM: Sent to Approver 
         TO: Assign to Approver

2. Maintain one "Booked" status code in the dropdown. 
    Retain the one highlighted in yellow (refer to Issue 
    Screenshot) as this follows the correct progression of status 
    codes 

3. Add the status code "Loan Disbursed". Place it below the 
    "Sent for Disbursement" status code

4. Hide the "Sent for Review (Post-Booking)" status code - 
    UNLESS BNext can explain the purpose and what types of 
    Applications will be displayed."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? If relevant:6) Is there any requirement/resolution/new product release moved on to production environment? details:
DETAILS:
Layout: Additional Source of Income (Business) 
In Borrower Detail Page - Occupation and Income

1. In the object name Additional Income Source(Business) - 
    there should be space between "Source" and "(Business)" 

2. MPI wireframe (prescribed design) is different from BNext 
    approach
    a) In MPI Wireframe, the intended design is: 
        [1] One Additional SOI table containing both Employment 
             and Business highlights for Indiv Borrower 
        [2] One Additional SOI table containing Business highlights 
             for Non-Indiv Borrower 
    b) BNext approach is: 
        [1] One Additional SOI table for Employment 
        [1] One Additional SOI table for Business - used for both 
             Indiv (Self-Employed) and Non-Indiv Borrower 
    c) We will clear this approach for INDIV BORROWER, but must 
        add the missing field column in Additional SOI-Business 
    d) Refer to Expected Results for the details

4. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F, #206 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Sub-Section: Additional Source of Income (Business) 
Section: Occupation and Income
Record: Indiv Borrower (Detail Page) 

1. Add space between "Source" and "(Business)" 
     FROM: Additional Income Source(Business) 
     TO: Additional Income Source (Business)

2. Add the missing field column marked with ** (two asterisk) 
    purely for your reference only and follow this order:
    [1] Income Source ID             [5] Company Size 
    [2] Employment Type**         [6] Monthly Sales 
    [3] Business Name                 [7] Include in DSCR
    [4] Nature of Business

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Elapsed Days 

1. Elapsed Days is system-computed using Acquisition Date 
    (user-inputted field) and Date Today as variables 

2. When Acquisition Date is deleted, the value in Elapsed Days 
    remains. Does not change to zero or blank. See Issue 
    Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #154

3. These are the User steps: 
    [1] User fills the Acquisition Date, then saves the Unit 
         Record. User observed that Elapsed Days is auto-
         computed in Edit Page, and value is displayed in Detail 
         Page after saving
    [2] User navigates back to the Unit Edit Page, then deletes 
         the Acquisition Date (User observed that the Elapsed 
         Days did not auto-compute, it retained its previous value 
         despite the deletion of Acquisition Date) 
    [3] User saves the Unit Record and observed that the 
         previous Elapsed Days value is still present 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Elapsed Days  
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

1. Automatically recompute Elapsed Days when Acquisition 
    Date is changed or deleted 

2. Reflect the updated Elapsed Days in Detail Page upon 
    saving

3. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s
subject: UNIT RECORD | Field: Elapsed Days

details:
DETAILS:
Process: Creation of Multiple Unit Records - Part 1
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

1. BNext successfully developed the preferred approach of 
    automatically creating multiple unit records via the field 
    Number of Units. 

2. These are the observations and insights: 
    a) The Number of Units field is only present when adding a 
        Unit. It is hidden once the Unit Record is created 
    b) When Number of Units is used, it creates multiple Unit 
        Records equivalent to the value indicated in Number of 
        Units. Sample, if Number of Units = 2, system will create 2 
        Unit Records upon saving 
    c) In Main FA - Unit Details section, the additional unit 
        contains the same Vehicle Details with that of first unit. 
    d) But in Unit Record (Edit and Detail) of additional unit, 
        all fields are blank - including the Vehicle Details section 

APP ID: 182316

EXPECTED RESULT:
Process: Creation of Multiple Unit Records - Part 1 

1. When Number of Units is filled, the created Unit Records 
    must contain all the same Unit Details: 
    [1] Application Details 
    [2] Vehicle Details 
    [3] Loan Details 
    [4] Application Status - specifically the Remarks, if any

2. Confirm that the Number of Units field is intentionally 
    hidden once Unit Record is created. It is only displayed in 
    the Add Unit page.                               

3. Apply the auto-copy in Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    of all created Unit Records via the Number of Units field
subject: UNIT RECORD | Process: Number of Units Part 1

details:
DETAILS:
Layout: Accounts and References (Edit) 

1. Accounts and Referneces did not follow the required field 
    placement and layout 

2. We designed Accounts and References to be in a tabular 
    form. But BNext approach is Data Object Bank (unsure if this 
    is the correct name). 
    a) This is not preferred because when saved in Edit Page, 
        the data is in vertical form instead of horizontal. It is 
        inconvenient to User. 
    b) The data is just in one column, so it extends the page. If 
         User adds multiple Accounts and References, and it will 
         be in some accounts esp Non-Indiv and Truck accounts 
         where Borrowers are Self-Employed, it will be a very 
         long page. It is inconvenient esp if User needs to edit. 
    c) Right now you may have less appreciation of User 
        experience because testing-wise, you only add 1 or 2. 
        But in real applications, Accounts alone can run to 10 or 
        more esp fleet clients like logistics companies. Add 
        References which can be 5 or more - imagine how long 
        the page will be

3. Revert to the original requirement, use table approach.

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Section: Accounts and References
Record: Indiv and Non-Indiv Borrower (Edit) 

1. Use Table Approach when encoding Accounts and References  
    a) Can add, edit, delete Accounts and References, including 
        if encoded in earlier status code and updated in later 
        status code. Sample, encoded in QDED, then it can be 
        deleted in QDED, PFDE, or FDED status    
    d) Lookout: Under tabular form, ensure that mandatory fields 
        are tagged accordingly (with *)

2. Follow MPI layout below for display order of field columns.
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F #229







3. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB,SP
        [2] Add Borrower Page 
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB (no SP because 
             there should be no Non-Indiv SP)

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Include in DSCR

1. As indicated in MPI Field List, Include in DSCR has validation 
    a) If Contributing Tag = YES 
        > "Include in DSCR" checkbox = Enabled 
    b) if Contributing Tag = NO 
        > "Include in DSCR" checkbox = Disabled 
    c) If Contributing Tag = changed from YES to NO 
        > "Include in DSCR" checkbox is automatically unchecked 
           and disabled

2. Bottomline, Include in DSCR can only be checked if 
    Contributing Tag is YES.  

3. But in both Borrower Record and Additional SOI, no 
    validation exists between Include in DSCR and Contributing 
    Tag 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Include in DSCR
Record 1: Indiv and Non-Indiv Borrower-Edit Page 
Record 2: Additional SOI for Indiv and Non-Indiv Borrower

1. Add validation in "Include in DSCR" checkbox
    a) "Include in DSCR" - enabled if Contributing Tag YES 
    b) "Include in DSCR" - disabled if Contributing Tag YES 
    c) "include in DSCR" - auto-uncheck and disable if 
         Contributing Tag changed from YES to NO

2. Alternatively, after observing normal approach used, BNext 
    can also add validation triggered when User clicks Next, 
    Save, or Finish. 
    a) If "Include in DSCR" is checked (means YES) + Contributing 
       Tag is NO or Blank, display validation 
    b) Validation Message: Include in DSCR cannot be YES because 
       Contributing Tag is NO or BLANK.
    
3. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower 
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB,SP
        [2] Add Borrower Page 
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower 
        [1] Update Borrrower Page of PB,CB
        [2] Add Borrower Page 
   c) Additional SOI - Employment of Indiv PB,CB,SP
       [1] Add Employment
       [2] Update Employment
   d) Additional SOI - Business 
       [1] Under Indiv PB,CB,SP 
            (1) Add Employment
            (2) Update Employment 
       [2] Under Non-Indiv PB,CB
            (1) Add Business
            (2) Update Business"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? DETAILS:
Field: Actual Referror Name 

This is related to issue in Excel UAT Report Batch D #130 (still unresolved as of writing) where we cannot fetch Referror details 

1. Because we cannot test the Referror Fetching, we also 
    cannot test if the fetched Referror can be deleted or 
    unselected. This is to handle: 
    a) Changing Actual Referror 
    b) Changing the Account Source from Branch to another 
        value 

2. We also cannot test if changing the Account Source from 
    Branch to another value will automatically remove the 
    previously fetched and selected actual Referror Name

3. But since there is no delete icon in the Actual Referror Name 
    field, we assume these are failed tests 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Actual Referror Name 
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page) 

1. User can delete or unselect the previously fetched and 
    selected Actual Referror Name. This is to handle: 
    a) Changing Actual Referror 
    b) Changing Account Source from Branch to another value 

2. System will automatically reflect the updates once saved: 
    a) Display the new selected Actual Referror 
    b) If Account Source changed from Branch to another value:
        [1] Reset the field Actual Referror Name (i.e. becomes 
             blank) 
        [2] Hides the Referror Details Object in Edit Page 
        [3] Hides the Referror fields (Referring Branch and Actual 
             Referror Name) in Detail Page

details:
DETAILS:
Actions: Unit Search 

1. We noted there are 2 Application Searches made available 
    for MPI: Main FA Search and Borrower Search. This was okay 
    in MVP1 since Unit is still folded under Main FA. 

2. In MVP2, we noticed that Unit Search is not available. While 
    this is not specifically required by MPI, this is also noting we 
    dont know exactly what approach BNext will use to handle 
    multiple unit 

3. This came about because of the limitation brought about by 
    the existing Application Search functionalities. If one unit is 
    already booked but other units remained in PAF or Pre-
    Booking, the Main FA will remain in PAF and therefore 
    means can only be searched under PAF status. 

4. Requesting please for BNext to suggest how we can search 
    unit/s from a Multi-Unit Application. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Actions: Unit Search

1. BNext to suggest how to search unit/s from a Multi-Unit 
    Application - where we can specifically search for units in, 
    for instance, PAF, Assign To (LCH, SSO, PO, Approver), Pre-
    Booking, Booked, Disbursement, and Disbursed status"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Field: Date of Birth in Individual Related Parties (Edit) 

1. Currently, Date of Birth is a mandatory field. 
    a) But as per MPI Field List, Date of Birth is mandatory only 
        if certain criteria are met - and these criteria aligns with 
        the input variables to run file checks. This is enumerated 
        in Expected Results
    b) NFIS and TU will run on Related Parties that meet certain 
        criteria. Date of Birth is required on those Related 
        Parties 
    c) Securing Date of Birth of Related Parties is very 
        challenging for the Business. Hence, we only require it 
        when necessary. 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Date of Birth in Individual Related Parties  
Record: Non-Indiv Borrower (Edit Page) 

1. Date of Birth - Mandatory starting QDE Doe if ANY ONE 
    condition is met (e.g. if Effective Share=19.99% but Rel Type 
    is Authorized Signatory, DOB is still mandatory)
    [1] Effective Share >= 20.00%
    [2] Relationship Type = Authorized Signatory 
    [3] Relationship Type = Beneficial Owner
    [4] Relationship Type = Immediate/Direct Corporate 
                                      Shareholder ? 20% Effective Shares
    [5] Relationship Type = Intermediate/Indirect Corporate    
                                      Shareholder ? 20% Effective Shares
    [6] Relationship Type = Senior Management
    [7] Relationship Type = Trade Name
    [8] Relationship Type = Others - Credit-Material

2. Lookout: These are the mandatory fields if any one of the 
    conditions above is met 
    [1] DOB                       [4] ID NUMBER
    [2] CIVIL STATUS          [5] COMPLETE ADDRESS
    [3] ID TYPE                  [6] CONTACT TYPE

3. Apply in: Non-Indiv Borrower PB,CB 
    [1] Update Borrower Page 
    [2] Add Borrower Page"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? DETAILS:
Field: EIR (Effective Interest Rate) - Part 2
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

This is continuation of excel UAT Report-Batch E, #148

3. We inquired how the IRR computation was setup considering 
    the variable OTHER CHARGES is not available yet in Data 
    Entry. This resulted to the discussion of triggerring EIR 
    computation at 2 stages: first in Data Entry and second in 
    Pre-Booking because this is where Chattel Mortgage Fees is 
    finalized

4. Not discussed is the retriggering of EIR in Amendments. But 
    EIR recomputation will be naturally covered since the 
    current IRR will be recomputed following current loan 
    computations design. 

5. The Gross CMF Amount field is found in: 
    [1] Unit Detail Page: Disbursement Tab - Incidental Fees 
    [2] Unit Edit Page: Fees and Subsidies Tab - Incidental Fees 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: EIR - Part 2
Record: Unit (Edit, Detail Page)

4. Compute the Monthly EIR and Annual EIR at these stages 
    a) Data Entry - where the EIR computed considers OTHER 
        CHARGES as 0 since data is not yet available 
    b) Amendments - where the EIR computed may have 0 or 
        actual value in OTHER CHARGES depending if User (Loan 
        Originator) encoded and saved the Gross CMF Amount
        field found in Incidental Fees (data source for the 
        variable Other Charges) prior Amendments. 
    c) Pre-Booking - where the EIR computed may have 0 or 
        actual value in OTHER CHARGES depending if User 
        (PBO/A) encoded and saved the Gross CMF Amount field 
        found in Incidental Fees 

5. System to perform the EIR computation everytime the Unit
    Record of first and additional unit/s (if any) is saved in: 
    a) Data Entry - PQDE, QDED, PFDE, and FDED status 
    b) Amendments 
    c) Pre-Booking - Sent for Pre-Booking status where only the 
        Monthly EIR and Annual EIR are recomputed."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
DETAILS:
Field: EIR (Effective Interest Rate) - Part 1
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

1. The EIR field is missing in both Edit and Detail Page. This was 
    discussed previously with Deep (and cant recall if with Ali,
    Akash and/or Nilabh as well). Subsequent to that discussion,
    we shared Loan Computations v4 which consolidated the 
    loan values computations - including EIR (same in MVP1) 

2. To refresh - EIR was an MVP1 requirement. In the EIR 
    calculator, 2 kinds of EIR are MONTHLY and ANNUALLY: 
    a) In MVP1, BNext developed the MONTHLY EIR and labelled 
        it IRR. But business requirement is the ANNUAL EIR. 
    b) This was the gap in MVP1 as the wrong type of EIR was 
        computed and displayed. But this was not a showstopper 
        then, hence the correction was moved to MVP2. Notably, 
        the Monthly EIR (or IRR in LOS) is not entirely useless 
        because it contains variable to arrive at the Annual EIR.
    c) Refer to Issue Screenshot - where we compared the 
        formula of Monthly and Annual EIR. But refer to file Loan 
        Computations v4 for the details.

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: EIR - Part 1

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Net Monthly Installment 

1. NMI is automatically rounding up by 1.00 even if the actual 
    system-computed NMI has .00 decimal points. You can 
    validate this in MVP1 as this caused major issues in 
    Production. We recall this being handled during UAT but 
    during cutover, it reverted to the wrong value logic 

2. Final NMI follows this logic - if initial/raw computation has: 
    a) Decimal points of .00, the NMI is NOT rounded up 
    b) Decimal ponts of .01 to .09, NMI is automatically rounded 
        up by 1.00 

3. Sample: 
    a) Refer to Issue Screenshot for an actual account in LOS.  
        if you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
        uploaded, refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #182 
        [1] NMI in LOS is ?112,001.00 
        [2] NMI in Excel Calculator is ?112,000.00 
        [3] This is due to the rounding up as explained in #3 
             above. The correct value should be ?112,000.00 
        [4] As a result of wrong NMI, other related fields in LOS 
             also with incorrect values because NMI is a variable: 
             Prompt Payment Discount, Gross Monthly Installment, 
             PN Amount, Total Interest, Other Deferred Credit 
             Interest, and IRR (to be renamed Monthly EIR)
    b) To illustrate further: 
        [1] Initially Computed NMI = ?35,000.00 
             Final NMI = ?35,000.00 
        [2] Initially Computed NMI = ?35,000.01 
             Final NMI = ?35,001.00 
        [3] Initially Computed NMI = ?35,000.99 
             Final NMI = ?35,001.00 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Net Monthly Installment 
Record: Unit (Edit Page)

1. Update the logic for Final NMI. Follow sample illustration 
    below as additional guide. 
    a) Computed NMI with decimal points of .00, the NMI is not 
        rounded up 
    b) Computed NMI with decimal ponts of .01 to .09, NMI is 
        automatically rounded up by 1.00 
    c) Sample: 
        [1] Computed NMI = ?35,000.00 
             Final NMI = ?35,000.00 
        [2] Computed NMI = ?35,000.01 
             Final NMI = ?35,001.00 
        [3] Computed NMI = ?35,000.99 
             Final NMI = ?35,001.00 

2. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit and Detail Page 
    [2] First and Additional Unit/s 
    [3] All status codes where Unit Data Transfer can be 
         triggered - PQDE, QDED, PFDE, FDED 
    [4] Assess also Post-Approval Finalization as the Unit Data 
         Transfer feature in that stage may have been affected 
         as well with whatever happened in Data Entry. This is just 
         being proactive."1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Details: 
Process: Completing Credit Verification - Part 2
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

1. It was observed that Credit Verification Records have a 
    default Verification Status of NOT APPLICABLE (not DRAFT). 
    Hence, was able to move forward without updating the status

2. Also, as explained to us (or as we understood it - in relation to 
    the Audit issue), since cannot hide NOT APPLICABLE as an 
    option in Verification Status, system will instead display 
    validation if selected by User. But in the test performed, no 
    validation was displayed 

AppID: 181835

Expected Result:
Process: Completing Credit Verification (Part 2)

1. Set the default (initial) Verification Status as DRAFT. User 
    should not be able to move aheasd to next verification if 
    Credit Verification remains as DRAFT 

2. If User selects NOT APPLICABLE, display validation when User 
    clicks the NEXT button: "Update Verification status to SAT or 
    UNSAT before you can proceed" or an equivalent of this 
    message."

3. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower: PB,CB,SP Credit Verification
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower: PB,CB Credit Verification
        *Note: Non-Indiv SP not mentioned because there should 
         be no Non-Indiv SP"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? details:
Details: 
Process: Completing Credit Verification - Part 1
As this is originally logged in excel, the space is not enough. Hence if you are reading from the Case Portal, you will receive the issues under different case numbers.

1. An update in the Credit Verification approach is: 
    a) Display first the Credit Verification Detail Page, where 
        the Loan Info hyperlink is available (globe icon). 
    b) Intended User action is to open and save Loan Info before 
        moving to the Credit Verification Edit Page where User 
        can perform other credit verification actions - including 
        updating the Verification Status 

2. Tester Action: 
    a) While in the Credit Verification Detail Page, Tester did  
        not open and save the Loan Info page. 
    b) But when "Next" button was clicked, still moved to the 
        Credit Verification Edit Page 

3. Issue: This is a system design weak point as it is prone to User 
    oversight. User should not be able to move to next page 
    until the Loan Info page. 

AppID: 181835

Expected Result:
Process: Completing Credit Verification (Part 1) 

1. Introduce system control when completing the first part of 
    Credit Verification. 
2. From the Update Verification insight card, when User is 
    directed to the Credit Verification Detail Page:
    a) Hide the Next button. To display it, User must open the 
        Loan Information page and save it 
    b) Default hide the button everytime User opens the Credit 
        Verification through Update Verification insight card 
        [1] It has been observed that in the case of multiple 
             Borrowers, User will be able to open and re-open the 
             credit verification page as long as not all Borrowers 
             have been updated.  
        [2] This is okay, but should force the User to re-save Loan 
             Info to ensure changes are captured 
3. If BNext has a better approach, please discuss with MPI. But 
    such solution should restrict User from moving ahead unless 
    Loan Info page is saved. 

4. Apply in: 
    a) Indiv Borrower: PB,CB,SP Credit Verification
    b) Non-Indiv Borrower: PB,CB Credit Verification
        *Note: Non-Indiv SP not mentioned because there should

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Vehicle Usage 

1. We observed that once Vehicle Usage is selected and saved, 
    the next time User intends to update Vehicle Usage, User 
    needs to reselect the value in Vehicle Condition first. 

2. To replicate, do the following as a sample: 
    a) Application Details: 
        [1] Loan Type = AUTO 
        [2] Vehicle Condition = NEW 
        [3] Vehicle Usage = PRIVATE USE
    b) Save the Unit. Then navigate back to the Unit Edit Page, 
        and click the Vehicle Usage field 
    c) The only option available is PRIVATE USE. See Issue 
        Screenshot for reference 
        *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
         uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch E, #169
    d) Click the Vehicle Condition field, choose "Select", then 
        choose "NEW" 
    e) The Vehicle Usage field will reset. Click it, will now 
       display all the applicable LOVs 

3. This step is unnecessary and will confuse User. They will 
    initially think its a system error. As what happened to Testers 
    as they rated this as failed because they couldn't select 
    another value 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Vehicle Usage
Record: Unit (Edit Page) - Application Details

1. Vehicle Usage should retain all the applicable LOVs even 
    after Unit is saved. No need for User to reselect "Vehicle 
    Condition" just to trigger the display of all applicable LOVs

2. Apply in: 
    [1] Unit Record Edit Page 
    [2] For first and additional unit/s
subject: UNIT RECORD |Field: Vehicle Usage

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Downpayment 

1. As per MPI Field List, Downpayment % and Downpayment 
    PHP must both be user-inputted and system-computed. This 
    feature is existing in GDS and we required to be maintained 
    in BNext LOS. Through technical inputs from MPI IT Team, 
    we shared / emailed how it can be handled 

2. But it was later shared that BNext cannot replicate the GDS 
    feature - each field can only carry one feature, either 
    system-computed or user-inputted. With these as the only 
    options, the preference is to maintain current Downpayment 
    features: 
    a) Downpayment % - system-computed 
    b) Downpayment PHP - user-inputted 

3. But this is logged as an UAT issue to highlight that this is one 
    of the requirements which yielded failed test. Functionally 
    speaking, we cannot argue if the requirement is indeed 
    technically impossible noting we are using it in GDS. Hence, 
    our request is to explain this to the MPI IT team as they are in 
    best position to understand the difficulty. 

APP ID: --

details:
DETAILS:
Field: Doc Stamps Tax 

1. As per Loan Computations v4, the Doc Stamps Tax is 
    rounding off on decimal points. But in LOS, its rounding off 
    on place value "units". 

2. When we were discussing this with Deep, we presented these 
    rounding off rules, which follows the default or standard 
    rounding off design in excel.
    a) 10.001 to 10.004 = 10.00 
    b) 10.005 to 10.009 = 10.01

3. In UAT, we observed that Doc Stamps Tax is following the 
    rounding off rules for Net Monthly installment, where 
    decimal points .01 to .99 are automatically rounded up to 
    1.00 - as illustrated below. But it should be as explained in 
    #2 above
    a) Excel Calculator Loan Computations v4 = 12,941.25 
    b) LOS = 12,942.00 

4. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
     *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
      uploaded, then refer to excel UAT Report-Batch E, #151 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Field: Doc Stamps Tax
Record: Unit (Edit Page)

1. In Doc Stamps Tax field, round off the decimal points using 
    the standard / default excel rounding off design where: 
    a) 0.001 to 0.004 = 0.00 
    b) 0.005 to 0.009 = 0.01 

    Sample: 
    [1] 10.001 to 10.004 = 10.00 
    [2] 10.005 to 10.009 = 10.01 

2. Apply in: Unit Record Edit Page for first and additional unit/s"1) Problem definition:2) Specify Use Case(Steps) to describe the issue:3) Is related screenshot attached?:4) Object(Lead/Account/Case etc):5) Are related event log/exception log triggers provided? Additional Business Address (Indiv-Edit) 

1. In Additional Business Address, did not follow the required 
    field placement and layout

    BNext approach is Data Object Bank (unsure if this is the 
    correct name). 
    a) This is not preferred because when saved in Edit Page, 
        the data is in vertical form instead of horizontal. It is 
        inconvenient to User. 
    b) The data is just in one column, so it extends the page 
    c) As it is, address fields are also not in proper order. But 
        will no longer be highlighted in Expected Results since we 
        prefer the tabular approach as noted below. 

3. Revert to the original requirement. You can create 2 
    +ADD NEW buttons - one for PH and one for non-PH address, 
    which is same with our wireframe. With validation that can 
    only encode max 3 additional business address (combined PH 
    and non-PH)

    wireframes created by BNext and MPI was perfectly okay

    Business Address

        in earlier status code and updated in later status code. 
        Sample, if additional address was encoded in QDED, then 
        it can be deleted in QDED, PFDE, or FDED status    
    b) Have 2 add buttons - one for PH and non-PH

        address (combined for PH and Non-PH)

details:
DETAILS:
Layout: Additional SOI-Business (Edit Page) - Part 1
For Non-Individual Borrower 

This is related to Excel UAT Report Batch F #202-204 which were about Indiv Borrower - Self-Employed and Informal Self-Employed 

1. The Additional SOI did not follow the MPI wireframe 
    a) As indicated in sign-off document: 
        [1] If fields will be in one page column, display order of 
             fields must follow the latest MPI wireframe
        [2] If fields will be in two page columns, follow the field 
             placement in the Detail Page (latest MPI wireframe), 
             since this page organizes fields in two columns. 
    b) We observed that the Additional SOI-Business has been 
        mixed up between Indiv and Non-Indiv. There has to be 
        unique Additional SOI-Business pages for Indiv and 
        Non-Indiv. Because of unique fields under each Borrower 
        Type, field misplacement will naturally happen if we force 
        them to share same page 
    c) There had been new fields added in the page which also 
        contributed to the overall field misplacement
    d) The address fields are in correct field placement. The 
         business fields are not. 

2. Place the fields according to MPI wireframe. Please 
    understand this follows the encoding structure of Originators 
    based on their interview guide.

3. See Issue Screenshot for reference 
    *If you are reading this from Case Portal and image is not 
     uploaded, then refer to Excel UAT Report-Batch F #231 

APP ID: --

EXPECTED RESULT:
Page: Additional SOI-Business (Edit Page) - Part 1
Record: Non-Indiv Borrower 

1. Follow MPI layout below
    *If you are reading from Case Portal and MPI layout is not
     uploaded, then refer to excel UAT Report Batch F #231 
    a) Rearrange the business fields following MPI layout, which 
        accounted for additional fields (vs orig MPI wireframe) 
    b) Image below is for field placement only. Mandatory field
        tags, though not visible in the image, must be in place.

2. Apply this in:

details:
We have observed another Issue in the Build related to the Read from Data Source Task, which is a critical functionality, causing issues in reading the Source Files Shared by Client.

Problem  The Read from data source task is not working as expected in the Product

details:
Problem Statement:    
As per our observation,  gender and TIN are mandatory at the callback stage for loans lead in CRM. This shouldn't be the case, the gender and TIN should NOT be mandatory at the callback stage regardless of the product and role of the user.
Brief Details of the issue being reported:    
gender and TIN are mandatory at the callback stage for loans lead in CRM.
Affected Application:    
 CRM
Issue Start Time:    
 2nd week of January 2026
Business Impact:    
CRM user performing callback activities are required to enter Gender and TIN even though these fields are not relevant at this stage.
CRM user may be unable to proceed if the customer is not ready to provide personal information like TIN during a callback and there is a possibility that they will put a dummy value in TIN field in order to proceed with saving the lead. 
This compromises CRM data quality and impacts downstream processes such as profiling and/to reporting.
subject: Gender and TIN should NOT be mandatory at the callback stage regardless of the product and role of the user

details:
I would like to provide an update on the status of the CSF retagging activity.
Last Monday, we initiated the first batch of retagging by loading 411 BBNs (from RBS to BBS) via the bulk upload facility. However, during the process, we encountered an error within the CRM facility that resulted in the failure of the transfer.
The issue has already been escalated to the CRM team, and an Ivanti ticket (No. 343794) has been formally logged for their investigation. Based on the initial assessment, the issue is isolated to BBNs moving to BBS and WBS only. The root cause is still under review by the CRM team, they're already in coordination with vendor and ITG.
To further validate the scope of the issue, we have tested 5 BBNs going to RBS, and no issues were encountered during the process.

In the interim, we have temporarily paused all retagging activities going to BBS and WBS to prevent further issues while the investigation and resolution are ongoing.
Given that transfers to RBS are currently not impacted, we would like to seek the confirmation of the stakeholders on how to proceed:
-Should we continue processing BBNs going to RBS, or
-Should we wait for the CRM fix and retag the entire universe in one go once the issue has been fully resolved?

Please let us know your preference. We'll keep the group informed and provide updates as soon as more information becomes available.
subject: A new error has been encountered during the processing via Bulk Business & Client Segment updates.

details:
Dear Team,

We are observing the slowness while calling /prospect/saveLead API from whatsapp Banking

As Checked internally, The stored procedure UJVN_FETCH_LEAD_DETAILS_FROM_PROSPECTID is using a clustered index seek but it is actually reading a very large number of rows (32 Million), causing high I/O.

To avoid this large data scans, we recommend creating non clustered index on column Lea_ex5_171.

Please find the attached Execution plan and recommended index for reference.
subject: WhatsApp banking API issue - Apply for loan - "https://dc-prd-esb.ujjivan.com:7849/prospect/saveLead","

There is an issue in the Leads object – View section affecting certain roles.
For these roles, the Leads View displays only a single record, whereas it should display up to 10 records per page, based on the pagination and view configuration.

This behavior is inconsistent with the expected functionality and differs from other roles where the Leads View correctly displays multiple records (up to 10 per page).

As a result, users with the affected roles are unable to view the complete list of leads as intended.

details:
'Offer import for WCDL in CRMNEXT' Job Failed in the 'Validate Data in main LT' Task.


PFB error Details.

Error : 'Exception Details ORA-12899: value too large for column "KOTAK_BANK"."KMB_OFFER_WCDL_LT"."CUSTOMER_NAME" (actual: 52, maximum: 50) ORA-06512: at "KOTAK_BANK.KMB_VLDT_OFFER_DATA_LT", line 85 ORA-06512: at line 1 at OracleInternal.ServiceObjects.OracleConnectionImpl.VerifyExecution(Int32& cursorId, Boolean bThrowArrayBindRelatedErrors, SqlStatementType sqlStatementType, Int32 arrayBindCount, OracleException& exceptionForArrayBindDML, Boolean& hasMoreRowsInDB, Boolean bFirstIterationDone) at OracleInternal.ServiceObjects.OracleCommandImpl.ExecuteNonQuery(String commandText, OracleParameterCollection paramColl, CommandType commandType, OracleConnectionImpl connectionImpl, Int32 longFetchSize, Int64 clientInitialLOBFS, OracleDependencyImpl orclDependencyImpl, Int64[]& scnFromExecution, OracleParameterCollection& bindByPositionParamColl, Boolean& bBindParamPresent, OracleException& exceptionForArrayBindDML, OracleConnection connection, OracleLogicalTransaction& oracleLogicalTransaction, Boolean isFromEF) at Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleCommand.ExecuteNonQuery() at Acidaes.Integration.Dal.DalBase.ExecuteNonQuery(String providerType, String connectionString, CommandType commandType, String sql, DbParameter[] parameters) at Acidaes.Integration.Dal.Engine.ExecuteSource(TaskInfo taskInfo, InputParameterCollection parameters) at Acidaes.Integration.Bll.Engine.Tasks.ExecuteStatement.OnExecute(ExecutionContext context) at Acidaes.Integration.Bll.Engine.Executable.Execute(ExecutionContext context)'

As per our checks in the LT table 'CUSTOMER_NAME' coloumn allows only 50 characters. But in the SP(KMB_VLDT_OFFER_DATA_LT) same is updating in the LT from the 'Accounts' Table 'NAME' Coloumn.

details:
We would like to raise this concern. We started receiving tickets on October 31, and to date the issue remains unresolved. Could you please provide us with a permanent fix for this matter?

Problem Statement (RCA):  
Login fails due to a CAPTCHA validation error despite correct input. Users are unable to log in because the application rejects the CAPTCHA response. Even when the encoded CAPTCHA value matches the displayed value, the system prevents authentication.

We currently have a workaround for this issue (please see attached file). However, the workaround is only a temporary measure. We kindly request that you review this and provide us with a permanent fix to ensure system stability and user accessibility.

Impact:
- Operational Disruption – Users cannot log in to perform CRM functions such as managing customer data and tracking leads.
- Productivity Loss – Users are spending additional time attempting to log in or escalating the issue, reducing overall efficiency.
- Possible Customer Service Delays – Inability to access CRM may lead to delayed responses to customer inquiries.
- Escalation Risk – Continued login failures may result in increased ticket volume and potential dissatisfaction among end users.


Request:  
Given the recurring nature of this issue and its direct impact on business operations, we urgently request a permanent resolution to prevent further disruptions and ensure seamless user access moving forward. Timely action will help restore user confidence and reduce the growing backlog of support tickets.
subject: Request for Permanent Fix – CAPTCHA Validation Error

details:
"1) Elaborate the problem statement in detail.

The Attachment field (Field ID: 7542) should provide only a single attachment option, “From Device”, with support for multiple uploads. However, despite configuring the field accordingly, the system is still displaying an additional option (“DMS Attachment”), which is not expected.


2) Specify Use Case (Steps) to describe the issue:

A) A Document type field has been created on the Case object with:
Field ID: 7542
Label Name: Document Attachment NonGMPC
B) The Folder Name has been set to: RHB

C) Under field configuration:
Attachment document from option: Dual Source
Upload behavior: Allow multiple uploads

D)The field has been added to all layouts of the Case module, including but not limited to:Digital,Request-SST and Others,Feedback,Query,Other Case-related layouts

E) The field “Document Attachment NonGMPC (7542)” has been renamed to “Attachment” on the new edit page.
F) All available options under the field configuration for Document Attachment NonGMPC (7542) have been tested.

Actual Output: The attachment field displays two options:
                          1)  From Device
                         2) DMS Attachment

Expected Output: The attachment field should display only one option:
From Device, with support for multiple file uploads
The DMS Attachment option should not be visible.

H) All the option under field configuration of "Document Attachment NonGMPC(7542) has been tried but still we are facing this issue.

details:
Requirement:

 - While Importing csv file for bulk update, on UI below mentioned message is displayed under Notes:
    "Note : On slower internet connections, import of 5000 records is supported at a time. If your csv/txt file contains more than 5000 records, split your file into smaller files and import them separately."

This message needs to be slightly change as below:

"Note : On slower internet connections, import of 2000 records is supported at a time. If your csv/txt file contains more than 2000 records, split your file into smaller files and import them separately."

As, while importing more than 2000 records, system keeps on loading and process gets terminated. Hence, want to alter the message as above


Use Case:
 - On UI it is mentioned that user can upload upto 5000 records at a time for bulk update through import functionality.
 - However, when trying to upload more than 2000 records, the system loading and post 20 mins process gets terminated.
 - Hence to maintain the consistency, we need to change the count on UI from 5000 to 2000
subject: RBI | Request to change message on UI while Import

details:
While testing bulk close functionality in CRM for CIP phase 2 requirement. Not getting  expected results.

Expected result:- Super – checker can allow to close the bulk case on any status with the requitement. And the access should be only for the CIP payout executive and manager Role.

Actual result:- while using the bulk upload cases closure functionality, only super checker assigned cases are closed. And checker assigned cases are not closed and received the validation error.

details:
In Report 18, there is an issue when multiple records share the same Lead ID (e.g., appearing in rows 16 and 17).
Currently, the same Lead ID is displayed repeatedly, resulting in duplicated values.

The expected behavior is that:

When the Lead ID is the same, it should be displayed only once, and

The subsequent duplicate rows should have the Lead ID field left blank for clarity.

Example:

Current display:

16 → 0056778

17 → 0056778

Expected display:

16 → 0056778

17 → (blank)

This issue affects readability and clarity of the report output, especially when viewed on mobile or exported formats.

IDX (29/01/26) : This case ID can be closed, was resolved in SIT.
subject: BNI | SIT New Version Findings | All Modules | SR 8 | Duplicate Lead ID Display Issue in Report 18

details:
While entering the OTP during login to the portal, the OTP text box displays upward and downward arrows. When these arrows are clicked, the field increments or decrements values (1, 2, 3, etc.), which is incorrect behavior for an OTP field.

Steps to 

-Navigate to the portal login page.

-Enter valid login credentials.

-On the OTP screen, click inside the OTP text box.

-Observe the upward and downward arrows appearing in the field.

-Click on the arrows to see numeric increment/decrement behavior.
subject: IOB | OTP Text Box Displays Up/Down Arrows During Login

Problem - The read only rule is not getting executed as expected after applying necessary conditions
There is a status code called "Assign to Department", when the case is currently on new case status and when we try to select "Assign to Department" from the ribbon, then the ROR is getting applied on a particular field present in the ribbon.

Expected Result - The field should remain read only even after selecting the status code as "Assign to Department" from the ribbon before saving.

Instance
//s3.businessbywire.com/appdev/businessnext/Home/Summary
prateek & password : keres@05

Steps to recognize the
1. Login through above details.
2. Navigate to cases, and click on create case
3. Select "Request - Merchants"
4. Create a case with necessary details and click on save and proceed.
5. Once the case is on New Case. Click on edit and select assign to department from the ribbon.
6. The "Assign to Next Department" should be read only but it is not reflecting the same.

 Rule Name : Assign to next department ROR

 
Layout = Request-Merchants
Status code = Assign to Department
Previous Status Code = Assign to department

Communication email trail in open activities between customer and executive should get trigger and created  from the same email id , i.e (kli.crmtest2@kotak.com).

Communication email trail in open activities between customer and executive  are  not getting trigger due to 2 different mail id's are used by CRM portal.

details:
CRM Issue Details:  The processing of a case request for updating contact information—specifically the mobile number—was completed in SSC without any errors. The request proceeded to a “Resolved” status; however, the updated mobile number / email address did not reflect in the CRM 360 View records.
This indicates that while the SSC workflow processes the request, the information is not successfully cascaded or synchronized to CRM 360.
Business Impact:  Expected SSC behavior is not working as designed, resulting in inaccurate or incomplete customer information in CRM 360.
Delays in processing client requests, leading to customer dissatisfaction and potential complaints.
Rework is required, as the team needs to file a new request to correct or update the information, increasing operational workload and turnaround time.


Case ID 18682044

Note: This issue is Resolved on its own. RCA is only needed
subject: RCA - Behavioral Issue – SSC Contact Information Update Not Reflecting in CRM 360

Instance
//s3.businessbywire.com/appdev/businessnext/Home/Summary
prateek & password : keres@05

Steps to recognize the
1. Login through above details.
2. Navigate to left navigation bar.
3. Click on "Non GMPC/Internal SR/NTB" quick link.
4. select "Is Internal SR?" as "Yes" and "Is Existing Customer" as "No" and "Source Channel" as "Walk-in"
5. Enter L3 as "Settlement Payment Not Credited", the other details will get auto-populated.
6. Click "Next"
7. Enter the Mandatory fields and click on "save and proceed".

details:
Existing AE reports are not getting converted to native, and only newly configured reports are reflecting in the native format. This inconsistency is creating challenges, as the expectation was that both existing and new AE reports would be automatically converted to native without requiring any additional configuration. Due to this issue, we are unable to leverage native functionality for already developed reports, which is impacting usability and causing rework. We request your support to help resolve this issue and to share a clear timeline for addressing this gap.

details:
For the CCOPs layout, the Turnaround Time (TAT) is being calculated on the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of the month, which should be treated as holidays according to the holiday master. Upon review, the SLA rule and configuration indicate that these days should not be included in TAT calculation. However, users have reported that TAT is still being calculated incorrectly.
Observation:
As per the SLA rule, TAT calculation is based on the current owner or the assigned territory. Even though the respective users have holidays defined in the holiday master, these holidays are not being considered during TAT calculation.
Details:

SLA Name: CC-CC-Voice-Call-Request-1
Impacted SRs: 251226857385, 251226857115, 251226856222

Regards,
Nidhi
subject: Incorrect TAT Calculation on Holidays for CCOPs SRs.
