details:
It appears that the system is currently assigning Josephine Co as the Team Head for this Team (Customer Service Operations). However, she is an Area Head, not a Team Head. In the previous GOLD 5 version, the Team Head for Customer Service Operations was Security Bank Admin, but this is not reflected in CRM today.

Business Impact: 
1. All newly created CRM users are automatically defaulted to report to Josephine Co.
2. Josephine Co is seeing leads from other Areas and Head Office users, especially in the Sales Leaderboard dashboard, even though these should not be part of her scope.
3. This causes wrong reporting lines, incorrect visibility, and misalignment in the organizational hierarchy. 

BBN:  N/A
CRM Case ID: N/A  
Replication steps (if available):  
1. Login as Admin
2. Go to Team Management
3. Check Manager Name
subject: Incorrect Team Head Assignment for Customer Service Operations

details:
This issue appears to occur across all objects on the web application that use text boxes.

During the edit process, when text formatting is applied—such as center alignment, text color, or other styling options—the formatting is correctly reflected in the editor at that moment.

However, after saving, the content is displayed in a plain style, and all previously applied formatting is not retained.

This behavior indicates that text formatting changes are not being persisted after save, even though they appear correctly during editing.

details:
Problem Description

We are populating Authentication Status from a Datapresenter (HTML type) into a keypair-type field using JavaScript.

The value appears to be populated successfully in the UI.

However, when the user clicks Next, an error is thrown.

On further analysis, it seems the value is not actually getting mapped to the keypair field internally.

Observations :

If the same value is manually selected in the keypair field, the flow works correctly.

The same JavaScript logic works without any issue when the target field is a normal text-type field.

JavaScript Used : 
saveToCRMField('cust_7541', passed ? 'Success' : 'Failed');

Analysis / Expectation:

Based on the above behavior, it appears that saveToCRMField is not correctly binding or persisting values when used with keypair-type fields, even though the UI reflects the value.

Please let us know if any additional logs or sample configurations are required.
subject: RHB | Issue in Manual Questionnaire – Keypair Field Not Mapping Value from Datapresenter (HTML)

details:
Use cases Log types:

1.    Application /Web servers service down – Detect when the application/Web service stop or become unresponsive.
2.    Configuration changes - Monitor for any unauthorized or unexpected changes in configuration files
3.    Authentication changes – Detect excessive failed login attempts within as short period.(Root/ Admin User)
4.    Database Connection Failure / DB Unreachable - All transactions and workflows fail
5.   API Dependency Failure (Upstream/Downstream Service Down) - External/internal service outage affects app
6.   Sudden Spike in Application Errors (4xx/5xx Error Surge) - DoS / overload / backend crash detection

details:
Hi Akram,

We are encountering an issue in production related to the case history. Specifically, the AssignedTo column is being updated incorrectly. Here’s the scenario:

A case is created and initially assigned to person A.

The case is processed by A.

Later, person A is deleted from the system.

After this deletion, the case gets reassigned to person B.

However, in the case history, every time the case is closed or updated, the AssignedTo column incorrectly shows B instead of retaining the original assignments (i.e., it should reflect A first, then B).

In short, the history should record that the case was assigned to A initially, and then to B—but currently, it only shows B throughout.
subject: KLI || User History Issue

details:
Hi,

We have identified an issue in the stored procedure used for the report “Escalated Complaint – All SRs Report.”
In the SELECT statement, the column cas_ex12_138 (IO Referral Amount Paid) is being converted to DECIMAL(10,2). However, in the underlying table cas_ex12, the same column is defined as DECIMAL(38,6).
Because of this mismatch, the report fails with a conversion overflow error whenever the value exceeds the limit of DECIMAL(10,2) (i.e., when the number has more than 10 digits).
Requesting you to please check feasible option to alter SP to use a higher precision (for example DECIMAL(38,6) or DECIMAL(38,2)) to prevent the report execution from breaking.

Thanks.
VinothKumar
subject: Decimal Precision Error in SP for “Escalated Complaint – All SRs” Report

details:
We have received a requirement from Dupaco where they would like to receive a notification if a scheduled job does not run at its scheduled time.
Currently, in the BusinessNext 
Notifications are triggered when a job executes successfully
Notifications are triggered when a job fails during execution
However, there is no notification triggered in scenarios where the job does not start at all at the scheduled time (for example, due to scheduler issues, service downtime, or infrastructure-related reasons).

For this, we have been suggested for 'Service Monitoring Setting', but when tested it was not working as expected. Please look into this.
subject: DUPACO| Synchronization 's Service Monitoring Setting is not working

details:
Observed behavior:

Whenever a custom field is migrated, the associated Case flow breaks.

As a temporary workaround, the flow starts working again only after:

Randomly selecting one of the recently migrated custom fields

Editing it and saving it again (without any actual change)

Problem with the workaround:

This is not deterministic — there is no clear indication of which field needs to be edited.

In real scenarios, multiple custom fields are migrated at once.

Editing and saving each migrated field manually is not scalable or feasible.

The client has reported that this issue occurs multiple times at random, making it operationally risky.

Impact:

Case processing is disrupted unpredictably.

Requires repeated manual intervention post-migration.

Creates uncertainty and impacts client confidence in migrations.

Expectation / Ask:

The Case flow should automatically recognize and bind migrated custom fields without requiring manual edit-save actions.

Product team’s help is needed to identify:

Why flows are not re-binding after migration

Whether a post-migration refresh / recompile / sync is missing

Or if this is a known defect with a recommended permanent fix
subject: DUPACO|Cases| Flow Break after custom field changes

details:
We have identified a recurring issue in our environment that requires your immediate attention.
If the system is not restarted for more than six days, it begins to behave abnormally. The application starts throwing exceptions and displaying error messages on the UI. After some time, the APIs also begin to fail, leading to service disruption. Restarting the system temporarily resolves the issue, but the problem reappears after another six-day cycle.
subject: System Instability After Extended UptimeOthers-Others

details:
During troubleshooting, we observed that multiple pods were stuck in a Pending state. As an initial step, we attempted pod restarts and scaled down the respective deployments; however, these actions did not resolve the issue.
Upon further investigation of the pod events and logs, we found that the pods were not being scheduled on any nodes due to resource shortages. To mitigate this, we increased the node count in the ASG. Despite the additional nodes, the pods continued to remain in the Pending state.
A deeper analysis indicates that the issue is related to volume mounts. Scheduler logs highlight a volume node affinity conflict, meaning the Persistent Volumes associated with these pods are restricted to specific nodes. As a result, the newly added nodes do not meet these affinity constraints, preventing the pods from being scheduled.
Additionally, we are now observing a 502 Bad Gateway error in Grafana.
subject: Pods in Pending State & Grafana 502 Bad Gateway Issue

details:
Dear Team, 

There is a single job responsible for generating all Common Reports, which runs from a shared path on the Primary Services Server.
When this job is in progress and the Integration Services restart at the same time, the job gets stuck. Although we can re‑initiate the job after the services restart, doing so results in multiple duplicate records being inserted into the report.
We request you to please review this issue, as we do not want duplicate entries in the report.

Job Name: Export report data of All Common MTD SRs
Stored Procedures:  Created SP: AXIS_JOB_EXPORT_ALL_MTD_COMMON_CREATED_SR
Report Name:  All Common Created SR
subject: All Common Created SR Report – Duplicate Records After Job Re‑Initiation

details:
User Impact:
All users from the Call Center team reported that they were unable to perform customer searches. Additionally, a few users reported that they were unable to log in.

Initial Findings:
During our investigation, we observed that several background jobs were stuck, which appeared to be causing the issue.

Action Taken:
As a temporary workaround, we restarted the integration services. This resolved the problem for now, and users are able to continue their operations.

details:
When I create a lead and save it with a closure status code, a system error is displayed. However, the lead is actually saved successfully, and upon refreshing the page, the lead appears correctly despite the error shown on the UI. subject: INC0012326908 - HDFC Import User Details into CRMNEXT

details:
Dear @Kulvir Saini,

This is with reference to the RBL Bank production database performance findings related to the GB8 application. Recently, we identified the Top 10 CPU-intensive database queries (shared in the email trail) which were experiencing high execution time. Due to this, we also observed intermittent restarts of one of the Businessnext-App pods caused by high memory consumption.

Upon analysing the execution plans for these CPU-intensive queries, we noticed that 2 indexes are reported as missing in the execution plans.

We request you to please align someone from your team to re-verify these execution plans and advise whether we can proceed with creating these 2 missing indexes on the RBL GB8 production database. Additionally, your guidance on any further possible query tuning would be highly appreciated.

Please let us know if any additional details are required from our side.
subject: RBL GB8 Production DB Performance Findings – Review of Execution Plans and Index Recommendations

details:
"1. What is status of integration service during incident
2. Check CPU and Memory utilization of Integration POD/Database.
3. Check if issue is Job specific or overall performance for Integration Jobs
4. Share Job and Task name which is stuck, also share volume getting processed in impacted batch.
5. Volume comparision with ideal scenario where Job got xecuted successfully?
6. Check Long running/Blocking/IO wait time queries on DB level and verfiy stuck task's procedure is running or not.
7. Check batch-size(Insert/update/delete/EDS task type) set in impacted task configuration.
8. For EDS type task check Externalsourcelogs and verify time taken by individual record to fech results.
9. Check for any network latency.


For Non-Cloud Application (Upto GB7) :
1. Check for exceptions in Log4net file.

For Cloud Application (GB8 Onwards) :
1. Check for the exception in OTEL for impacted task.
2. Please check if logging and tracing is enabled on intgration service(Verify configMap,serviceConfig yaml)."

details:
The client has reported that a few complaints in the CEPC module are not being assigned to the appropriate users. It has been observed that critical fields such as Complainant State, District, Processing Office, and RBIO Territory are not being stamped on these complaints during processing.

Due to the absence of these mandatory mappings, the system is unable to assign the complaints to the correct users and offices. Instead, the complaints are being auto-assigned to the Super Admin role.

As a result of incorrect assignment and lack of visibility to the concerned users/offices, these complaints have remained pending for more than 200 days, leading to significant processing delays and client escalation.


Process Step:- Complaint Creation via complaint portal for CEPC entity 
1. Open Complaint Portal
2. Enter captcha 
3. fill the complainant details 
4. Select any CEPC entity details from Entity list field 
5. Select No to All auto closure question 
6. Fill all the required in page 2 and 3rd page
7 Click on Submit for lodge a complaint 
8. Search Complaint no in application
9. All details will be available on the complaints e.g processing office, RBIO territory, Assigned to , RBIO Owner Stamp, Complainant State and District
subject: CEPC Complaint details not stamped on complaints

details:
It is being reported intermittently across SSC's and Roles that users are unable to reassign case's when selecting the "Reassign" option on the top Ribbon. When this is selected, the 2 boxes for selecting User/Queue and Name of User/Queue do not appear. If save is selected, status is updated to reassigned but owner/assigned to remains the same employee. 

Case's in question can be identified but the attached snip which states, "This stage does not require any additional information". 
Interestingly, this message can be present at one instance, but when returning to a case later, may not be present and function correctly. 

2 instances where the message was present but later were not were 693208 and 710386. 1 instance where the message is present as of creation of this case is 702810. 

I personally have experienced this previously and in case 702810 under role Software Development. 
Another user (other 2 examples) experienced this under role Deposit Operations. 

A previous case was submitted but resolved as the "work around" is to use the Reassign button on the bottom of the screen, but this issue needs additional research and resolution as we shouldn't be using a workaround for a main function of the system
subject: Unable to Reassign via Standard Ribbon task

details:
Dear BusinessNext Team,

We have identified an issue related to alerts, where some users, upon opening an alert from the summary page, are redirected to a different alert with a different subject.
After conducting our assessment, we found that certain jobs are creating alerts manually without updating the **ID_LIST** table. This results in multiple alerts being created with the same **alertId**, which causes the incorrect redirection behavior.
One of the identified jobs was the job that are delivered to us with the name **"Doc Expiry Check and Send Alert"**, and the related stored procedure involved in this issue is **BNI_ALERT_INFO_GEN_ID**.
Based on our findings, this issue has been confirmed for the above job, and it is possible that there are other jobs or stored procedures that are generating alerts in a similar manner.
In this regard, we kindly request your assistance to:
1. Perform an assessment to identify any other jobs or stored procedures that may be creating alerts without properly updating the **ID_LIST** table.
2. Provide guidance or a resolution approach to prevent duplicate alert ID generation and avoid similar issues going forward.
Thank you for your support. We look forward to your feedback.
subject: BNI | Production Findings | SR 385 | Miss on Alert Creation

I am writing to request your approval for manual attendance regularization for Case ID: 534392. Due to my assignment at the SBI client location in Belapur, Mumbai, I was unable to access the PeopleStrong portal for attendance marking. This restriction, combined with my night shift schedule, led to challenges in performing manual punch-in/out procedures and the following attendance gaps:

Dates Requiring Regularization:

·         21st January 2026 – Status: "HD"
·         23rd January 2026 – Status: "MIS"
·         27th January 2026 – Status: "MIS"
·         28th January 2026 – Status: "HD"
·         30th January 2026 – Status: "HD"

Since I have already utilized my monthly regularization limit, I kindly seek your special approval to regularize my attendance for the above-mentioned dates. I understand this is an exception and assure you that I will coordinate with the client site administration to establish a better attendance marking process going forward.

I would be happy to provide any additional documentation or clarification if required. Thank you for your understanding and support in this matter.

details:
As reported by client during VAPT testing on UAT that they are facing issue where 'The application is disclosing the name and version of the server. A malicious user can use this information to launch further targeted attacks. ' To fix this issue we have to install IIS URL Rewrite Module. Kindly check the server details mentioned below where we have to install.
192.168.0.19:4876
User ID : .\coach
Password :Bisleri@500
 
DB:
Server Name : 10.196.158.19
CRMNEXT_AUFIN_G7
ID: crmnext
Password: abc123
 
instance 
https://s202.businessbywire.com/G7/app/login/login
user Id : JS 
Password : acid_qa

192.168.0.67
 
user - IIS 
 
password - Admin#987

Additionally below are the steps to install the 
install the IIS URL Rewrite Module on any Windows server running IIS 10 (Prod / UAT / DR).
How to install IIS URL Rewrite Module on any server (Windows / IIS 10)
🔹 Prerequisites (must be checked first)
Before installation, confirm:
✔ Windows Server (2012 R2 / 2016 / 2019 / 2022)
✔ IIS role installed
✔ Administrator access on server
✔ Server is 64-bit (almost always true)
STEP 1: Verify IIS is installed
On the server:
Open Server Manager
Confirm Web Server (IIS) role is installed
OR via command line:
iisreset /status
If IIS is not installed, install IIS first.
STEP 2: Choose installation method (2 options)
✅ OPTION 1 (RECOMMENDED): Offline MSI installer
✔ Works on any server
✔ Best for secured / production environments
✔ No internet required
Steps:
Download the MSI on any machine:
👉 https://www.iis.net/downloads/microsoft/url-rewrite
Download:
Copy the MSI to the target server
Login to the server as Administrator
Double-click the MSI → Install → Finish
Restart IIS:
✅ OPTION 2: Web Platform Installer (if internet allowed)
⚠️ Use only if server allows outbound internet.
Steps:
Download Web Platform Installer:
👉 https://www.microsoft.com/web/downloads/platform.aspx
Install WebPI
Open WebPI → Search URL Rewrite
Install:
Restart IIS:
STEP 3: Verify installation (MANDATORY)
Method 1: IIS Manager
Open IIS Manager
Click Server name
You should see URL Rewrite icon
✔ If visible → Installed correctly
Method 2: Programs & Features
Control Panel → Programs → Programs and Features
Look for:
subject: UJJIVAN || IIS URL Rewrite Module Installation on Ujjivan Dev Server

details:
I am connecting to the IBM VPN using the office network, but the VPN keeps disconnecting frequently. Additionally, when I try to upload files to the IBM server using WinSCP, the upload speed is extremely slow (around 40–50 KB/s) and often results in timeouts.

I have tested the same setup multiple times using my home network, and the VPN remains stable there. File uploads via WinSCP work smoothly with speeds of around 1–2 MB/s.

This issue occurs only on the office network, which clearly indicates a network-related problem (possibly firewall, proxy, bandwidth throttling, or VPN restrictions).

Please check the office network configuration and advise on the issue.
subject: IBM VPN using the office network, but the VPN keeps disconnecting frequently

details:
Kindly provide output of below query:
This query provide just count of total user logins which have happened month wise.


SELECT 
    to_char(logindate + INTERVAL '330 minutes', 'Mon-YYYY') AS monthwise,
    count(userid) AS user_count
FROM loginhistory
GROUP BY to_char(logindate + INTERVAL '330 minutes', 'Mon-YYYY')
ORDER BY MIN(logindate + INTERVAL '330 minutes');
subject: Cloud Provisioning | User Login count month wise

details:
Kindly executed the below queries and provide the data.

1.Policy Log from 01-jan

select sbigpolicynumber,sbigcustid,CAST(Process_Date AS DATETIME) as Date,flag,Errorcode,replace(Errormsg,'|','~') as Errormsg  from sbig_create_policy_data_lt_log with (nolock)
where sbigpolicynumber is not null and CAST(Process_Date AS DATETIME) >= '2026-01-01 00:00:00.010';
 

2. Customer log from 01-Jan

Select SBI_Customer_ID, POLICY_NUMBER, PARENT_PARTY_ID, Status, Party_Type,  Errorcode, replace(Errormsg,'|','~') as Errormsg, CAST(Inserteddate AS DATETIME) as DATE
from sbig_ins_customer_data_in_log
where SBI_Customer_ID is not null and CAST(Inserteddate AS DATETIME) > '2026-01-01 00:00:00.010';

details:
Hi Team - Please share the data for below query from Main DB. 
    

WITH ranked_loginhistory AS (
    SELECT *
    FROM (
        SELECT
            ownerid,
            userid,
            logindate,
            ipaddress,
            machinename,
            ismobilelogin,
            ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
                PARTITION BY userid,
                DATE(logindate + INTERVAL '5 hours 30 minutes')
                ORDER BY logindate DESC
            ) AS rank
        FROM loginhistory
    ) t
    WHERE rank = 1
)
SELECT DISTINCT
    TO_CHAR(lh.logindate, 'DD-MM-YYYY') AS logindate,
    a.loginid AS LoginId,
    a.username AS UserName,
    r.name AS Role,
    ex1.USE_EX1_6 AS SolId,
    re.areaname AS Circle,
    re.zonename AS Zone,
    uc.Department,
    re.name AS Branch,
    lh.logindate AS llogindate
FROM ranked_loginhistory lh
INNER JOIN az_user a
    ON lh.ownerid = a.appownerid
   AND lh.userid = a.userid
INNER JOIN az_roleassignment rs
    ON rs.appownerid = lh.ownerid
   AND rs.memberid = lh.userid
INNER JOIN az_role r
    ON rs.roleid = r.roleid
   AND (r.appownerid = rs.appownerid OR r.roleid = 1)
INNER JOIN usercontact uc
    ON uc.companyid = lh.ownerid
   AND uc.userid = lh.userid
INNER JOIN USE_EX1 ex1
    ON ex1.ownerid = lh.ownerid
   AND ex1.use_ex1_id = lh.userid
LEFT JOIN regions re
    ON re.ownerid = ex1.ownerid
   AND re.regionid = ex1.USE_EX1_1
WHERE re.categorytype = 3
  AND a.appownerid = 988
  AND lh.logindate >= DATE '2025-10-01'
  AND lh.logindate <  DATE '2026-01-22'
ORDER BY llogindate DESC;

details:
Agent Page Refresh Issue

Observation: When an agent initiates a call from the Ameyo toolbar, the main HDFC Securities CRM page automatically refreshes. This causes the Ameyo toolbar (running inside an iframe) to reload, disrupting the agent workflow and impacting productivity.



Exotel Response & Analysis:
The issue originates from client-side scripting within the HDFC Securities CRM application, not from the Ameyo system.
The CRM page uses a script (ameyoLogin.js) that includes the function initialiseAmeyoLogin, which dynamically loads the Ameyo iframe.
When the CRM page refreshes, the script is executed again, matching the behavior reported (“the third-party CRM is initializing the login page after call”).
The CRM application contains an unnecessary event listener that is incorrectly monitoring actions within the Ameyo iframe and triggering a full page reload when a call is initiated.



Conclusion: The root cause is related to the CRMNext page logic, which is refreshing unnecessarily and reloading the toolbar.
subject: Update on Reported Issues Related to Toolbar Integration Panel | HSL
